review_data.review: Ate breakfast alone one day around 8 AM and surprisingly I had the place to myself, so service was no problem. I settled for their take on eggs Benedict, served on a potato roost and not some form of bread, which was a great fusion and perfect for breakfast.  I will go back again next trip to Siem Reap, I hope they survive and it is busier next time.

This is a relatively new Indian in Siem Reap - there are many - but I would put this in the top 3 straight away (not at number 1 though :) )  I tried something different from my usual lamb choice, Afghan Chicken from the tandoori dishes. Very fresh and succulent.  Service was great, the food came quickly and the price was on par with the competition.  Recommended.

review_data.review_title: One of best Indian restaurant in Europe
review_data.review: I have been traveling to many cities of the world and can vouch that this is one of the best Indian food in the world. Run by two brothers from Punjab India, you can taste their hospitality in the taste of food. Not to be missed if you are in Prague and like authentic Indian food.

We visited this restaurant during restaurant week. For $45 the 3 course meal was excellent. Tortellini in brodo was a wonderful starter, followed by superbly cooked chicken breast and thigh. A chocolate sphere with a nut filled filling and chocolate sauce was a gem. A must to revisit
Had coffees and desserts on a quick stop while cruising Patong. Real coffee! The hotel looks nice too. I will consider a couple of nights on my next trip to Phuket.

Took D&N as a second option for lunch, but it was rewarding. It is well located near the tourist area of Phuket Town.  Every dish was a masterpiece and well presented;  Phuket Beef Stew Braised Pork in Brown Sauce Salmon Ceviche Hokkaido Scallop with Thai Style with Garlic Chilli 2X Kombucha Cocktails 2X Smoothies Fruit Punch  It was so good we're going back for dinner tonight (next day)

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Fab cocktails in a nice garden setting
review_data.review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

review_data.review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

review_data.review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review_data.review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

review_data.review_title: Terrific Dinner in St Germain de Pres
review_data.review: Terrific set meal with wine pairings. Didn't realize they specialized in caviar -- and haven't like it before -- but one of the dishes in the meal had it and it was the first time I enjoyed it. Service was excellent and meal very enjoyable with a nice mix of dishes. Highly recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: This is not only a great dinner but a great experience. We were all Americans with one local Argentine but the conversation flowed as freely as the wine. Great to meet with and share life stories with other expats in Buenos Aires. Lots of interesting people. As for the meal, we started with a welcoming cocktail : Vodka, Hesperedina, Jengibre, Aji Amarillo, Jugos de Naranja y Durazno. The six course meal included Pan Integral Casero (a roasted eggplant dish), Berenjena Asada, caldo de Guanciale con Cinco Porotos (an excellent soup), Risoto Negro de Sepia, Adobo de Chancho (the star of the show in my view — a roasted pork dish that was best pork I have had), and finishing with Cheesecake de Especias (a homemade cheesecake with a tangerine topping(delicious). Each course was terrific and accompanying by well matched wines. The star in wine for me was the Desquiciado Garnacha 2021. Thank you so much everyone for a magical evening.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: I read the reviews and was still a bot skeptical, but count me as a believer. We had a lovely multi-course meal with wine pairings that was both creative and well-presented. Very warm and friendly service. Yes, you don't have a say here as to the food presented, but it is well worth the risk and detour. We intended to go to Montmartre anyway, and this is just a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Sacre Coeur. Heartily recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Having myself lived in Italy and consumed a fair amount of pizzas, I can honestly say that this is a true Neapolitan style pizza - and a great one indeed. I will be coming back, I can only recommend this place.

We had a great time with our friends there. Food was very good. The steaks came cooked as ordered and were great. Service was great, too. This restaurant is well known and always packed. You will need a reservation.

There is a very talented chef in this Restaurant. The Steak Menu as well as the Bouillabaisse @ 524.3 THB were excellent and nicely decorated. They change the menu daily at moderate prices. (I don't know why they not include the 7% VAT on the price list, it looks a bit cheating for me) The decoration makes the easy place look nice and there is enough parking space around. Although it is a bit noisy because of the nearby main street (this takes off 1 point from "excellent" for me). Of course I will go there again - the food is really very good.

I chose this restaurant because of the high ranking in TA (n°4 in Paris). The neighborhood is not all that good but I can't say I felt unsafe at any time on our way there and back by metro. The hospitality is very good: we got a warm welcome and all through the meal it stayed that way. After ordering some cocktails we had to wait for more than 1 hour before we got our menus! (after having asked for it). We then got some bread to cover the gap. The entry was presented beautifully on a plate but the mackerel was just smoked mackerel, nothing special. We ordered a beef medaillon for mains: the taste of mine was good and juicy but my wife's was actually bleu whereas it should have been medium rare. Also the temperature in the restaurant kept rising up till the point it was too hot to stil order dessert. We fled the restaurant. So a lower score to get the overall score back to a realistic level.
Need hangover food? Their $10 lunch menu has you covered! Pizza, loaded fries and more Free pool and big screen for sport This is where the Kiwi Crawl starts
While the food, taste and presentation both , was excellent.. we specifically loved the swing seating! Make sure you have reservation before visiting, as there are limited swings.

We ended in this little cute restaurant next to our Riad, the reviews were excellent and we definitely agree! We took “Le tajine des gazelle” with a mix of dry fruits (apricot, almond, lemon) and a traditional couscous. The plates are generous and homemade, so savoury! For 10€ you will enjoy the plenty of Marrakech. Waiters are so kind! You have to try this amazing little restaurant!

The restaurant is very nice and the service is friendly. The food is really great! We were a large group of 20+. They couldn't seem to handle our volume and variety of drink orders and this was pretty slow going. Food service was spot on and fabulous. Atmosphere of the restaurant is really nice. All in all, good place to eat in Siem Reap.

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer

review_data.review: This place was recommended highly by other trip advisor writers, so we tried it and we were not disappointed. It fed 2 people for 2 nights. We also noted that there is construction next door therefore parking is harder than usual. Order online or on the phone and go pick it up. They have seedy rolls to die for.

We walked to the place and ordered. All of the selections looked good so we had a battered fish taco and pork and chicken tacos. The beers are 9$NZD so we passed those up. It was pretty cold and rainy out the nite we came so we did not eat at the tables outside.

review_data.review_title: Gorgeous views and great entertainment make for a lovely night
review_data.review: We had drinks here after dinner and the entertainment was lively and very good. The team is attentive and helpful and the views of the city and the Bosphorus are stunning as the bar sits on the top floor of this luxury five star hotel. Great night had by all and fun.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Well, we finally got to eat here and we enjoyed it all! The food, the service and the ambiance were perfecto! Our waiter Noah (Noe) was wonderful and his recommendations were right on with the wine and the food. Not being rushed to finish your meal in NYC is always an issue. NOT HERE. The dining room was full and no one was rushed at all. When my husband request a little cheese and some proscuitto it appeared even though it was not on the menu! The foccia bread was amazing, we had to ask them to take it away so we had room for food. Great wine list! The my salmon was cooked perfectly and our dessert was eaten even though we had no room. Had to walk it off to the parking garage:)

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic

review_data.review: A nice place to sit down for a beer or two! We ordered Pantagonia Pilsener. The service and atmosphere was great!
We had not booked a table, but they find a place for us upstairs. Good service! The food was excellent! For the first time I didn’t finnish my steak - it was too big! :-)

I actually don't know where to begin because everything about our dinner here was perfect.  The food is so interesting; their take on 'egg & soldiers' (foie gras in an egg shell) was divine, the souffle has an emoji of the chef on top (niche), the strawberry and sour lime laces at the end of the meal served on a mini clothes horse etc. If it isn't presented in an interesting way, it's displayed beautifully. Also, don't want to give too much away, but just wait until the waiting staff (who are exceptional) come to clear the crumbs away from your table - the method is great and will definitely put a smile on your face. This is so much more than just 'good food'. Unfortunately my photos don't do it justice!  I've recently been to the Woodspeen near Newbury and the Latymer at Penny Hill Park, but Launceston Place takes the top spot. It really was one of the best dining experiences I've had in some time and I can't wait to go back.
Benihana never disappoints and is a great place to take your teens. Our chef was fantastic and performed loads of tricks, even repeating them for the teens to post on Instagram.

review_data.review_title: Small little local place with great food and service
review_data.review: We ate here twice during our stay in Marrakech.  Once we had the traditional Moroccan fare with tagines and the likes and the qulaity was far better than what we had in other places. The second time we had more western and Mediterranean food and it was quite tasty.  Both times we had dessert - crepes which were the best we have eaten and divine. You must try this when there.  Excellent service and really well priced compared to other restaurants in Marrakech.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Love coming here. Always busy and always great. Book ahead if you’ve got time as you’d hate to miss out on great food and great sake. Lovely cold Kirin on tap and a good little wine list. If you’re not sure about which sake to order the staff are happy to help with advice and even tastings. Also a great selection of Japanese whiskies
Like so many hospitality venues in NZ, Post COVID, they are short staffed. Good cocktails and a good wine list. The snacks we had were very good

review_data.review_title: Fabulous again with Karam at the Kinara lake view
review_data.review: Fabulous meal again at Kinara at JA lake view. We have been before and brought friends this time and the food was absolutely amazing.
Fabulous first time @Sette Italian With family and friends, will definitely be back. Lovely setting upstairs on the Top floor
Lovely place with an amazing and super tasty food! For special occasions is this place perfect. You will feel like a king and queen <3

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Amazing experience, food was outstanding and service top quality for Queenstown. We had Shane serving us who was extremely knowledgeable and made us feel so welcoming for such a big group
The restaurant is very good and we really enjoyed the show. Staff is very nice and attentive. Good reception. Special thanks to Mew (Nhev) for her outstanding service.

We came leaded by Tripadvisor and it did Not let us down. Refined food in an elegant environment. Outstanding service. We did an onLine reservation on their website in the same afternoon and they got it all under control.

One of those places in my wishlist for Siem Reap. The students cum trainee waitresses gave me a warm welcome. Felt good about it. Had lunch here, which I had Grilled Beef & Lemongrass Salad and drank Sala Bai Passion Breeze. The food kind of contemporary and the drink was so refreshing. Many food photos actually uploaded here and other blogs were obsolete cos they change the menu from time to time. The price is very reasonable considering they put effort to make your food looks presentable. Must try places.
Great food and great atmosphere. Very friendly staff. Dishes that you don't see everywhere and exceptionist. Looking forward to my next visit

review_data.review_title: Gracious hosts and super food with wide selection
review_data.review: The Indian Jewel is a wonderful restaurant. Because it was Covid we reserved a table outside the day before we wanted to come. They made the reservation at a table that was the best for us and were VERY thoughtful and kind throughout the meal. The choices on the menu are many. We all ordered something different and shared. Each dish was delicious. You cannot go wrong here!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Had breakfast here everyday throughout my stay. The international selection is amazing! I love how they serve fresh juice/veg shots at the juice bar!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: My US friends and myself would come here at least one a week! Meals with naan or rice under $10 and quick, great service. Loved their spicy veggies.

We were there their first night of a month in Lisbon. Over their first month went often. Wonderful place and wonderful food not the usual tapas.they have a daily special bread just from their region of Portugal. Excellent wine list. Fun music. We would go back to Lisbon just to see them. Several months on writing now from England out happy memories are even stronger.
Loving the ambience of the place gave me ideas on how to do my garden out when I get back home in England thank you for the inspiration

Found restaurant on TripAdvisor. Located in Le Marais near Republic metro. Warm welcome, lovely modern restaurant with fantastic waiters. This isn't just dinner, it's a dining experience! Offered choice of tables, we were upstairs with view of open kitchen- amazing! Had delicious cocktails to start, shared a houmous dish served with the freshest bread. Veal rump for the main with artichoke served 2 ways- you have to try it! Dessert was blood orange pavlova with meringue & cream and sorbet. Wine was available both by bottle or glass. We paired the main with a Côte de Rhône, 100% syrah. Whole experience cost less than €150, which was amazing value for such a fabulous experience!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Family run restaurant with local cuisine
review_data.review: Along a small street leaving from the Place Djama El Fena. We had moroccan food which was very delicious (tagine, skewers and pastilla). Prices were very fair and the people very friendly. Would definitely return.

review_data.review_title: Fantastic food provided with care and love
review_data.review: Really enjoyed a beautiful dinner at the Bunker last night with my wife and friends. The food was beautifully prepared and served with care and love. The ambiance in the restaurant was lovely and there was a very uncrushed feel to the whole evening.
Very small spot but the best pizza I ever had in restaurant. Visited with friends to try this special pizza . Ordered sprouts pizza and regular .. I can eat at this spot everyday ..... A++

Very elegant and cozy place. Christmas decoration made this evening especially special but the excellent food is worth going there all year round of course. I had the 5 course tasting menu and now I get hungry just thinking about it.
I had the 5 course dinner and although on the higher side than other tasting menu restaurants it was well worth it. The service was excellent and my nice waiter helped me making the right choices.

We were in Siem Reap for several days. This was without a doubt our best restaurant experience, and they were all ( except for one ) quite good. The Greek atmosphere was delightful, the food was superb and the service impeccable. We were three people. We ordered two Moussakas, 1 small (good size) Greek salad and spanokopita. Truly the best ever Moussaka I've had. Add in an imported beer and the tab came in. in the low 30's. Highly recommended.
Very upscale place with delicious food and professional service.An enjoyable experience. Food prices are reasonable, but drinks are on the expensive side for Cambodia

review_data.review_title: Great restaurant with an interesting experience!
review_data.review: We took the 5 course taster menu and it definitely did not disappoint! Each plate that came out was more interesting than the first! Not only was the food presented beautifully but each dish came with a show! I would highly recommend this place if you enjoy trying new culinary delights and tasting delicious pairings of wine!

As per previous reviews the food is exceptional. As we live in Dubai, with an abundance of fantastic Indian food, we usually find that British Indian food is not as good, however, in this case we would say it’s on par. The manager was delightful and made suggestions based on our preferences and he truly hit the mark. Both mains were from the Chefs Special and were delicious, Mon Mon Murug, and Bahari Lamb.

We chose to eat here on our final night and what a brilliant decision! All the staff were super friendly and very attentive. We did not feel forced to buy more drinks or pay the bill straight away, and were left to enjoy the rest of our wine after finishing the food, and I should add the indian wine was so tasty and we got a very large glass! Portion sizes were very big and the quality of meat was excellent! We had the lamb madras, chicken seekh kebab, basmati rice, garlic naan and some raita - all excellent. Thank you for making our last night so enjoyable! 100% recommend.

If you've eaten lots of tagines on your Moroccan trip and want something different, this is a good option. It is pricier, but in a lovely setting, service is great and they have some good wine. If you're vegetarian, remember to mention this, as they will bring you an amuse bouche with meat in, if you don't. The prawn starter is tasty, but I'd definitely recommend the smoked salmon tartare with avocado and balsamic vinegar, really tasty. The cheesy tortellini is also yummy. Although this restaurant is a little hidden away, there are plenty of signs to point you in the right direction from the main square.

Touring around Thailand and Cambodia, decided just fancied a nice Greek meal as a change from the Asian Cuisine. Went on Trip Advisor Resturant’s near me. Up popped Elia and I’m so pleased it did. Free Wi-fi excellent service food was absolutely beautiful and plenty of it, I went for the meat platter for one and the wife decided on chicken skewers, Although we where going to place everything in the middle with a bowl of hummus, Pitta bread and fresh lemonade for drinks. Have to admit everything was perfect, the accompaniments that went with it was also perfect, will certainly use this restaurant again when I’m wanting a change thanks to the chefs, and staff for the lovely service.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Amazing pizza! Very small place, but very authentic food. One of the best Pizzas you can get in this city.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: Almost 4 hrs of delight for your eyes and taste buds!
review_data.review: Blown away is an understatement. We were lucky enough to discover this place because our AirBnB was two doors down (literally!). You come across the front door, which looks like an abandoned storefront, ring the doorbell, then enter into the most intimate, romantic, charming place ever. You are blown away from the very first course. A truly artistic vision. And DELICIOUS! Each course is amazingly paired with wine. We ate and drank for 3.5 hours (a record for me!) but did not leave drunk or stuffed. Full and giddy would be a more accurate description. I truly hope you have a chance to visit this wonderful secret. And the price is surprisingly affordable (in American terms - we paid just over $100 per person).

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Our go to when we want great food and great service
review_data.review: We return often, and each time are welcomed warmly and treated to the best Lebanese food in London. We have visited with friends from the UK, Lebanon, Syria, South Africa, Oman, Dubai, Singapore, Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Bangladesh and Turkey, and they all rate the food and service as excellent.  This time was no different.  We ordered the Yakhneh Loubieh (Green bean in tomato sauce) vegetarian and the Yakhnet Bameh (okra in tomato sauce) vegetarian. Both can be prepared as vegan if you mention it. The food was piping hot and delicious.  The service, as ever, was warm and attentive.  We've already made our next reservation.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I booked a table for an early dinner, so that the restaurant would be quieter.  The staff, as always, gave me a warm welcome and offered me my choice of tables. I wanted a relaxed meal, while doing some reading, and the service was attentive and perfectly placed, so that I felt comfortable enough to take my time, but also so that I never waited for service.  I ordered the Taboulleh Twist, houmous Beiruty, Falafel and Yakhnet Batinjen Vegetarian, and enjoyed some Lebanese coffee with it. At the end, I had their refreshing Café Blanc with some baklava.  Every dish was amazing, and I would visit weekly if I could.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Chamisse is a staple in our London list. They always deliver great service and delicious food.  I took a friend - who knows Lebanese food well, and is involved in the restaurant industry - for dinner this week, and he was impressed with the quality and flavours.  We ordered a selection of the hot and cold mezze, and every dish was perfect.  Always happy to recommend Chamisse, and will no doubt be going back soon.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We consistently come back to Chamisse, and we're often bringing friends back with us.  The food is always delicious and the service attentive. We've come here with friends from the UK, Oman, Syria, South Africa, and they've all enjoyed the food and said how good it was.  Thank you to the staff for always being welcoming and for giving us somewhere to always share great food with good friends.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We visit Chamisse every couple of weeks and have never been let down.  We brought a friend here for dinner on Saturday evening, and again, the staff at Chamisse were incredibly welcoming. They were happy to make recommendations from the menu and were knowledgeable about all the dishes.  The food was delivered quickly, and every dish was tasty.  We've been visiting Chamisse for around two years now and have found it to be consistently excellent.  Were very happy to recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Decent pub food, make sure to check the receipt
review_data.review: Been here 3 times in our stay and pub food was consistently good. Recommend for a change in scenery from the resort. Pains me to say there seems to be an “honest mistake” scheme running with happy hour. The invoice each time is brought over and they quickly show your free drinks but the total you pay also includes the free. If you question it they then remove the “free ones” . Every time same problem. When pointed out the 3rd time the waitress got passive aggressive and began being super assertive. It is a classic ruse to gain funds. Don’t begrudge them in this time however check your bill if you care about your happy hour drinks :). Would I go back - sure. Would I trust the bill - no way
Nice place, close to the square. Food was great as well as the service. Unfortunately multiple dishes were sold out but this was communicated to us when we got the menu handed over. Would go again.

review_data.review_title: Perfect place for salads and fresh drinks!
review_data.review: Excellent salads and drinks. Their yogurt ice cream with amareto is super delicious! My favourite is falafel salad. The owner is very attentive and staff is super professional. Totally recommend if you want to make a break of couscous and tagine during your trip in Morocco:)

review_data.review_title: Fun evening with friends but not great food or service
review_data.review: Recently went here for a friends birthday as a large group of 12. We had been put into a private room away from the main area - which we were glad about as it was extremely loud in the main restaurant. The cocktails list is poor - most sound fairly unappetising and the only few we tried were not great & we wouldn't have ordered a 2nd. One had an ice cube in which was the size of the glass so was an utter rip off for what you receive. Once at the table, we asked for the wine list which was apparently non-existent as the waitress came back & read 7 wines from her notepad (not being able to tell us anything about any of them)! She explained they were between wine lists, however even if this is the case its fairly poor for any restaurant to not be able to manage this smoothly. We opted for the safe option of Prosecco and beers - after our 2nd bottle of Prosecco, none of the rest of the bottles were cold which the waitress seemed pretty embarrassed about. She also managed to spill half a glass over my friend when pouring it out. The food was ok, we ordered starters to share (the prawns were tasty) and each ordered a main with some vegetables to share too. At the point of mains, you are basically paying for the spectacle only as the portions are fairly small & food is fairly bland & overcooked. I had the seafood special & the salmon was the best thing since its such an oily fish it could take the extra cooking. The lobster was unfortunately a bit chewy. The egg fried rice was also very blend. Each person also got a pair of ramekins with a couple of sauces - these were not nice & didn't compliment the fish at all, one being overly mustardy - assumably to go with steak. For the entainment value, its a bit of fun with a group of friends but I wouldn't go here just for the food. It was also very expensive for what it is - our bill was over £120 per person by the end, which was without desserts & there were a few people driving. I would rather spend that sort of money knowing I'm going to get much better food & service. Unfortunately, we won't be returning and I wouldn't recommend to any food lovers thinking of going.
Simple and Classy. Nice pricey food but a perfect place to meet a business partner and have a quiet meeting in a nice atmosphere

review_data.review_title: What a waste of time and money
review_data.review: Jungsik was truly the worst Michelin starred restaurant I have ever been. We have started our night with dry greetings from the sommelier "We do not serve Korean drinks here sir, this is more of a French restaurant rather than Korean and our food is delicate". After tasting the seasonal menu I can confirm that it is bland not delicate. Tasteless, concept less, unimaginative food served in enormous portions. The big chunk of cod was murdered in a pepper sauce, the large layers of fat inside both pieces of lambs were probably there on purpose but definitely unappetising. Wine pairings with neither kicks nor soul. Mediocre deserts. Petit fours was only three. An unmemorable night you would want to forget, after digesting the amount in the credit card statement.
This is a great restaurant if you are looking for a nice burger with quick service in a great location.

We walked to Dar Moha after wandering through the Jardin Marjorelle gardens for the morning. The location is lovely, with tables around a nice courtyard pool. The food was very tasty and good, but maybe a bit overpriced. However, for the ambience and setting, it was a very nice stop.
Excellent food and excellent service taken Here by our son and girlfriend, suitable for all.Really friendly staff, would highly recommend.
We came here for the cocktails. And we have not been disappointed. They not only look great - they taste good as well.
Spent one night here and enjoyed it. If you‘re in the area it‘s worth checking out and have some nice drinks.

review_data.review_title: Wind down here after a long day out in the sun
review_data.review: Came here after a long day exploring temples in the sun. Arrived into a spacious area. Outside there was a stall selling soaps made from natural ingredients. You can wash your hands there to try out the products before entering. Makes for a great souvenir :) Inside, we ordered fruity ice mountains and a glass of ice blended coffee for our tuktuk driver. It was such a treat! The owners were extremely friendly and we could spent the whole afternoon there. Highly recommended!

review_data.review_title: We came back for dinner every night of our stay in Siem Reap
review_data.review: Friendly staff serving food cooked from the heart. Very sincere food which tasted spectacular. We went back for dinner every night and even celebrated my parents' anniversary there with them :) My husband only orders Ginger chicken but I would also recommend trying their khmer curry, amok fish and black pepper beef!

The ribs are absolutely awesome, we’d had a late breakfast so just wanted to share a full rack to see how the ribs rated and wow they did not disappoint, the waitress was great , very present in her job and quick to check everything was acceptable, we highly recommend this place

It was so lovely to be back again last night! As always, the food was incredible and the welcome and service amazing. Thank you so much for another wonderful dinner (and lunchbox!), we can’t wait to see you again soon :)
Great night in Rawai with good service from the manager Eak and live music. Great food and great views. Definitely worth finding this little spot!
We ate here a couple of times and found the food very authentic and a reasonable price. Nice atmosphere and good location. Nice change from local food.

Little Blackwood is a gem of a bar. They a great wine and beer selection and the cocktails look awesome too. The staff are always lovely and friendly and the live music gives it an awesome atmosphere!

Hosted our 15 person dinner party for my sisters wedding on the top floor. Great space with high ceilings and bar. Phenomenal food, service and atmosphere. Tailored the evening to fit with our party - delayed courses as we were having too much fun dancing to the band. Every course was a win not just from a taste but also visual perspective. Thanks so much for helping make the evening special for us all! We also ate here daily during our stay and didn’t have a bad meal. Excellent!

I went with three other colleagues for a top notch dinner. The atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice and international. The selection of different tasting menus and A la Carte was very good. The service was fast and observant. The wine list was also very good 7,5 out of 10.

review_data.review_title: Outstanding food with service to match
review_data.review: Took my wife to this restaurant tonight as recommended by the hotel (Lotus Blanc) I must say we had the most amazing experience, the staff were all superb, particularly Kia, and the food (we had the connoisseur menu) was out of this world, it was accompanied by wine, which for the price was very good value. I Can’t recommend highly enough, don’t let the name steak house fool you, this restaurant caters for a range of customers and if you want a special treat, this is the place to go.  I would dress up a little to enjoy it more!! Francis & Jill, from Scotland

Located in the heart of Palermo. A balanced atmosphere between elegance, classic style and modernity. Fast and very discreet service. We tried various cuts and types of meat, always excellent and really well cooked. Excellent choice

review_data.review_title: Great hangout with good food and lovely ambience
review_data.review: The food was simply delicious. We visited the restaurant for casual lunch and we had a great time. The team was great despite the rain pouring and the restaurant being packed. Everyone made sure people are taken care of. They were engaged and kind. I highly recommend the snow fish, their brownie is a must!

We visited for dinner based on the other reviews here and they certainly weren't lying. There are so many scams and rip-offs around but this restaurant is bang on. Fair prices, friendly staff and delicious food.  There was a queue for entry when we were leaving I think that says it all, especially given its a little trickier to find. Well recommended if you're looking for great local food at a good price

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: I'm so glad I tried this place. Visiting as a solo diner on a mid week evening, I was greeted by Brian the owner and promptly seated. As a westerner the menu looked pretty traditional with a number of familiar dishes all at reasonable prices I was soon tucking into my very tasty starter washed down with a cold beer and Brian was busying himself checking in with all the diners ensuring they were happy and everything was in order. My main was equally delicious (washed down with more cold beer) So a good curry with good service for sensible money and 5 minutes from my hotel. Highly recommended

review_data.review_title: Delightful! Must do for the wine lover!
review_data.review: Cute little place, just a block outside the main tourist drag. The waitress was friendly, proficient in English, and made some excellent recommendations for local wines to try. I had a cheese plate and focaccia as well, which were delicious. Reasonable prices. Highly recommended for anyone who loves trying local wines!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Great food with the best service.
review_data.review: Big, big thank you to Cloud Nine restaurant. The food is fabulous. Great variety to choose from on the menu and perfectly cooked and presented. Thank you to Nghia whose service is just the best. And all the rest of the team who do everything possible to please and give you the best dining experience, nothing is too much trouble in this Restaurant. The style, decoration and prices are second to none. Whether it be for lunch or dinner you must give this place a try. Highly recomended.

When you only have 3 nights in NYC, you want your choices to be really good. I choose Patsy's based on other Trip Advisor reviews, and its long history. My wife and I were seated in the back of the restaurant right up against the dessert tray! We both started with a Manhattan.Turned out to be the best thing of the night. Shared a caesar salad that had this "Sweet" strange dressing.Not a hint of an anchovy. Our waiter recommended a pasta(I can't remember the name) that was watery, not much flavor. We each had a glass of the Super Tuscan wine that didn't have much going for it either. I guess our photo, won't be up on the wall....

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Like Having A Meal in Paris
review_data.review: Lunch with a friend in December at Boucherie West Village is reminiscent of sitting in a Parisian restaurant. Festively decked out for the Christmas holidays, Boucherie was unbelievably busy on this Friday afternoon.  In order to dine in a New York City restaurant (12/21), one must show proof of a covid vaccination and we were lucky to also have a reservation for lunch, as the place became crowded quickly. There are 3 levels - the bottom level is the busiest since it is near the bar and kitchen. The 2nd level is smaller and intimate and the top level is reserved for larger parties.  We sat on the 2nd level and it was easy to have a conversation amid the hubub of the other patrons. Our waiter was very attentive and able to answer any & all questions. There was a separate waiter who took care of our water and wine needs.  My friend and I took advantage of the Prix Fixe menu by ordering the french onion soup, mussels, ravioli with mushrooms and chicken paillard. The only dish that was not enjoyable was the chicken - it was very dry and lacked taste. The onion soup was to die for, as were the mussels and the ravioli melted in my mouth.  We also had French white wine and dessert. The ambiance was festive and very Parisian. Will definitely return.

Great food at a great price with great service. It must be good....I used great four times...:) I had the pizza and the missus had the calzone. Both were fantastic. The owner spoke English... that was handy for me.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: Staff are so friendly and attentive! Ordered a nemo cocktail which came with a toy fish! My other half ordered a be prepared cocktail which came with toothpaste and a toothbrush. Just brilliant. Would definitely recommend if you're into cocktails
Popped in for lunch and had the baba ghanoush and farrouj meshwi. It was pure perfection. So tasty and succulent. Staff were friendly and attentive too, decently priced and even had a Lebanese beer!

review_data.review_title: Pay for a show to your kids.
review_data.review: All in the title. We arrived, and on a Wednesday night, full of kids screaming in the entrance, playing in the decorations. Thanks to the uneducated parents for that. Most tables had kids. The food was good, even if a bit pricey, but we accepted for the entertainment of having a chef repeating on every tables the same show with the food.  Food was nice, but not screaming in japanese, I would have said more American. (yes, a steak with onions and mushrooms can still talk to me...)  I would say a "you will like it" but not a "you will go back". Even if the chef wrote "I love you" with the rice : he did not won my heart. ♥  ( ps : I asked my steak blue! Heaven!!)

After so many great recommendations I tried it once for breakfast. Rude waiter and limited buffet style breakfast. For two avocado toasts and coffee we were charged 160€( for 2 persons). While paying waiter told us also some unprofessional things. Not a pleasant experience.

review_data.review_title: Best Indian food in the area
review_data.review: The food was wonderful- very tasty, good sized portions, some of the best Indian food I have tasted. Service was great. It isn’t cheap, but worth it for a special meal - we were 8 of us celebrating two birthdays.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: East Village place offers good pizza up until midnight. Dough base is good and thin, marinara is delicious and the pepperoni was also excellent. Definitely not cheap, 12" pizza is 16$ and up, but value is very good for the money.

review_data.review_title: Our Best Meal in Paris, Ever
review_data.review: The whole night was made magical by the owner, service, food, and setting. Been to Paris a number of times. Never had a single meal that was spot on in every way. Walked in about 20 minutes early and the owner immediately knew our reservation. He seated the 4 of us at an odd table right up in front of the bar. We were unsure, but as the evening unfolded we learned this was exactly the spot to have. He could watch over us from the bar like a wonderful host. We also learned he custom made the table which worked out exceptionally well. He made the wine suggestions which were spot on. Every course was wonderful. I have never taken photos of my food, but there is first time for everything. We left feeling we were leaving someones home. A night to remember and he and the staff were gracious to our limited French, we even shared laughs about how bad we were in the language department.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Excellent Ramen in Upper East Side
review_data.review: We visited this noodle shop after a long day at the Met. Being ramen lovers, we have high expectations for our ramen, and we weren't disappointed. We're hard to please, after having some incredible ramens around the world. Although this shop makes primarily beef-based broths, they also have chicken broths, which we prefer.  They have a good Sake menu too, and a bar dedicated to this wonderful spirit.  They have bench seating, so be prepared to share your table.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Siem Reap is a foodie's paradise. There is no shortage of wonderful places to eat when you are visiting this city. But be sure to include this one in your list.  The meal is done as a set menu - everyone gets the same dinner (excepting allergies). So it makes it simple, with no choices to make. The toughest decision is whether to have the wine pairing (4 glasses), or not. Have it.  The 7-course meal is presented slowly, and beautifully. It takes about 2 to 3 hours to get though dinner, and each course is fairly small. So although it may sound like 7 dishes is a lot, it feels perfect.  The restaurant, operated by the Kimsan Twins (I don't think they are actually twins), is entirely staffed by women. The kitchen, clearly visible from the first floor dining room, shows the skilled chefs at work, and provides a show to watch between courses.  The set menu changes seasonally, but I suspect that every season is a winner.  Eat here.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Oh so impressed with the dishes served on this visit. But take care finding the new location. If searching then make sure you find the “restaurant AND BAR” as there is another place now using a shortened name and it comes up first. The real POU is north of road number 6, whereas the clone is on wat bo road. The atmosphere is calming and pleasant, staff unobtrusive, prices are surprisingly low and the food is heavenly. Very very impressed. I live local so I will definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Wonderful Food, Great wine and awesome service
review_data.review: The scallop appetizer was really good, but the halibut was exceptional. We also had some great local wines. Highly recommend this.

My son, two friends and I enjoyed Sunday evening dinner in an intimate space with great meals, wine and service. We shared each other's entrees and all were outstanding: duck breast with couscous, roast chicken with potato puree and vegetables, and veal steak with chantarelle mushrooms and roasted corn. We enjoyed a flavorful sauvignon blanc (the wine list is heavily skewed French, naturally) to go with our meal, which was topped off by a perfect creme brulee. Service was efficient without being obtrusive. Some window walls open to give a nice, airy feeling to the room. We were very pleased with our experience there and will go back.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: We went for the vegetarian and chicken amok after reading the reviews and we were not disappointed. It was delicious and tasty. I would recommend a visit for this dish alone.

review_data.review_title: Amazing meal - favourite of two weeks in Asia
review_data.review: We went to Tevy's place on our last night in Siem Reap. We had read the reviews and thought we must go. We got there about 7pm and were told by members of the queue that they were told they were the last to be served. Being British we ignored the warnings and joined the queues. Luckily they managed to squeeze us in and we had the best meal we had eaten in our two week trip. It was amazing value and we paid a chunk more than the bill came to as we felt that it was worth it. We even brought a few drinks to take back to the hotel with us. The spring rolls are fantastic. Also they were great for vegetarians as my husband is one. Just wished we had discovered this place on night one in Siem Reap as we'd have been back every night. Thank you to the staff and cooks at Tevy's Place.

This restaurant is so incredibly small and authentic, it will become your immediate favorite! Seriously, the wait was long (but that's our fault), the seating is limited (but it's so intimate), and the food is amazing--absolutely amazing. Definitely eat here if you're craving the best Thai food in NYC!!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review_title: The best Italian Restaurant in Lisbon
review_data.review: I am a regular at this restaurant and I still think it is the best Italian Restaurant in Lisbon. The food is amazing. The staff is really friendly, specially Shekhar. He was super helpful during the intire dinner. The atmosphere is very romantic. If you are in the city center, I would totally recommend this place.

review_data.review_title: Great food in a beautiful setting
review_data.review: We shred beef Lok Lok, eggplant salad with sesame, Char koheung - fish dish and a beer to wash it down. Service was Ok but the restaurant was slammed with way to many large groups.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: This is an outstanding restaurant. I understand the high ratings over the years. The work coming from the kitchen are masterpieces. Chef does an amazing job of bringing flavors together. He is big on adding an orange tint to items, very different! They did nice presentation for my wife's birthday, this is appreciative. Also the service is outstanding, nothing spared yet is not over the top. Would highly recommend this establishment. Also $70 for 3 courses of this quality is very good compared to some other similar offerings in the city.

We went at lunch, experience is amazing. Very small and imtimate, tables are on top of each other, but that adds to the experience. Lunch is an incredible value, most of full menu options available for only $11, wow. The Sicilian Meatballs are amazing. Staff is all Sicilian, feel like you are there as they are all speaking native. If you want amazing hand made pasta, do go here, do not even think about showing up without a reservation. If you are looking for a quiet, say romantic setting this is not it. However the intimacy adds to the experience.

review_data.review_title: Top favourite place to dine in
review_data.review: One of my fav place to have delicious Mughlai food in Mercato mall. Visit once in 2months. Chef is remarkable. Relish all vegetarian dishes everytime.👍👍 A must visit recommended.

review_data.review_title: French lunch in the middle of Union Square
review_data.review: Inspired on a real french bistro, this NY restaurant is a very nice option when visiting the Union Square area. Their menu is completely French inspired and they execute it quite well.

We visited Pur' for my wife's 30th birthday and decided to have the 'As time goes by' tasting menu.  The food and service was exquisite, more of what you'd expect from a 2 or 3 Michelin starred restaurant in the UK than what is only a 1 star in Paris.  At €125 this is good value compared to other restaurants of a similar standard in Paris.  The menu was excellent and each course was a delightful experience full of great flavours and textures.  The service was commendable and with only one sitting you have the table for the whole night. This is a restaurant for a special occasion and a wonderful experience that will will not forget.  Thanks to Jean-Francois and his team. It was a pleasure.

We only came here because our Thai restaurant choice was closed. On entering the restaurant I had no idea what was behind the facade, which looks pretty ordinary, and said I wanted to eat inside. The waiter politely sugggested outside would be better and led me around the side of the building. I was really amazed, they have unique swing-mattress, bed like tables (though you can choose a normal table if you want) that make you feel like it is a high end restaurant in Marrakech (the last time I saw anything like this). So we were super comfortable and our toddler was in her element. The food was also great, the drinks wonderful and the prices, even with the 10% added at the end, crazy low given the ambience and environment. We will be back!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We had a great lunch here, along with tasty shakes, with massive portion sizes in terms of the massaman curry, enough for two easily. The waitress was really sweet and attentive too.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Simple but well cooked food with a smile
review_data.review: The tragic story of Tevy and her various projects and passions (local female artists and anti plastic crusade) are all over the walls of this little restaurant which gives it a unique and homely feel with a personal touch. The food is crazy cheap even by Cambodian standards while the portions are plentiful. Fish amok especially recommended, while the healthy and versatile juices/ shakes/smoothies were very nice too.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: Great restaurant with wonderful guest garden. Food was excellent, wine tasty and service very friendly! Thank you for nice evening in amazing city:)

Place was tight, and was full even an hour before dinner time. Nice dumplings - already worth a gourmand’s visit. Special Entrees were interesting, cheap fish cooked well the Chinese way, deep fried bartered squid with garlic, very nice to the bite, and wok sautéed beef with veggies that had a very appetising tangy taste.  Good price for what you get, worth the difficulty in language and the tight fit.

This had been recommended by several people and was our first restaurant visit in BA. There are 2 locations close to each other, so make sure if you make a reservation ( highly recommended) that you know which one you have booked. We were booked for Saturday 8.30 and it was packed. Great atmosphere and waiters were very entertaining (English spoken well). Excellent wine recommendation “Niento Senetiner” Malbec to go with our 2 steaks with massive portions of Patatas frites and mixed salad. Good value and great service and atmosphere - a winner
Restaurant seems very popular among tourists. Almost all tables were occupied around 19:00-20:00. All was tasty. Maybe soup could be better.

A nice but pretty standard Indian restaurant similar to that found in most places . Food is ok but nothing different to the norm. Service is ok. Prices are ok. Nothing really to right home about . Pretty empty.

So we we went to this restaurant twice , the first not been too bad and many restaurants still been closed because of Covid decided to go back. BIG MISTAKE. The food came in drips and drabs, the owner spent more time behind his pc doing take away. And the food was dreadful. Chicken tikka masala was like Heinz Tomato with a box of chili. I could go on and on about how bad it was but would rather not dwell. Siem Reap is beautiful, and this just put a dampener on everything good.

Best lamb I’ve ever tasted very nice restaurant and you would usually have to make a reservation to get into it but we were here during the Coronavirus panic so got in easily. The duck liver parfait was perfect to share between 3 people. When the world goes back to normal I hope this place opens again.

We dined here for an early dinner and the lovely staff seated us out of the way (we had two kids with us!) and provided crayons for the kids. The wine I chose wasn't to my liking so the staff kindly swapped it over for me, no dramas at all. Such a great asset to the restaurant to have such understanding, helpful staff. They don't have a kids menu and sides are extra so it can get quite expensive. Food is excellent, full of flavour and really delicious. One of our sides was some chips and found the serving quite small however everything was very tasty and the service was great so I would recommend.

My family of 4 (two children under 10) visited this restaurant based on hotel recommendation. The food is amazing, the prices are great, and the staff are friendly. We loved it so much I think we ended up eating here 3 times on our trip. Good luck only coming once!

review_data.review_title: Fabulous Indian food in the heart of New York
review_data.review: We visited for dinner one evening in New York while n holiday and had a great meal. We chose a vegetable biryani, dhal and baigan barga and it was all delicious! Friendly staff and nice decor too.

The view is the selling point of this place, and has therefore also found its way into other forums, including the Lonely Planet brief guide to Istanbul. The restaurant itself is also rather pleasant, and service is competent and good. I found the food to be absolutely average however. While perfectly acceptable, and a good place for a chat over dinner as the sun goes down over this fantastic city, one may be forgiven for not being too picky about the food. Based on a single experience I would reserve my judgement on the gastronomic quality of the place, and I would certainly recommend drinks and snacks here. But dinner was not one that I found remarkable.

review_data.review_title: A must go if you are staying in the Hotel
review_data.review: It was late when we checked into the Hotel so we decided to roam around the hotel and find food. We came to this Sea.Fire.Salt Seafood restaurant and decided we just eat here, that was the best decision the day.  We were impressed with how elaborated the Salt can be with every dish during our dinner. The staff appeared to know their Salts very well too. The recommended type of Salt for us tasted just great with our food.  We had a table indoor because it was raining. Ambiance was great. Food was great.  Service was prompt and attentive.

review_data.review_title: Very nice Thai food within the hotel
review_data.review: We were staying at the Anantara Layan Phuket Resort and was highly recommended this Thai fine dining restaurant by the hotel staff. Was a buggy ride away from the hotel room.  The view from the restaurant was great. Good before the sunset so that you can enjoy both the sunset and the night view.  Alfresco dining is recommended because you will have the unblocked view to the sea and the pool. But get ready your insect repellent and embrace the heat because the fans weren't helping much.  We ordered a set menu for 2 pax. Was decent but nothing exceptional. The pace of serving was a little too lengthy, we actually got bored waiting for food after a while. We got seated by 6 pm and we left the restaurant at 8.30 pm.  Would I recommend this to anyone? If you are staying at the resort, why not because you don't have much choices there.  If you are making a trip here from elsewhere, I don't think you miss much.

Had a great meal at Steaks by Luis. We were joined by five other diners at a communal table and the food, ambiance and service were great.  Upon arrival you're presented with a class of champagne and offered a selection of bread, cheese and meats. Once everyone arrived, you're brought into the dining room facing the open kitchen and windows that look out onto a terrace where Luis is preparing the wood grill. Before the first course, the fresh cuts of meat and cheese are presented and explained.  Each of the four courses are paired with a local wine which is generously (and continuously), poured. There was so much food and the delicious steaks were so huge that no one was able to finish everything beyond the salad course. I found the $75 per person price more than reasonable given the quality and quantity of both the food and wine.  Steaks by Luis is a closed door restaurant so you must make reservations in advance. Our email inquiry made on the website was responded to promptly.  It's easy to see why Steaks by Luis is one of the highest rated restaurants in Buenos Aires. Luis and his staff take great pride in what they do and it shows in every way.

We ordered dinner from Grab food and it was so good that we ended up ordering 3 times in 2 days..). The quality of food, taste, freshness and packing was superb. We tried their Turkish bread, assorted mezze, shish kebab - both chicken and chicken wings.  All items every time were 5 star. Highly recommended.

We were looking for a French place for breakfast and found this on TripAdvisor. It’s nestled in one of the cozy corners on Christopher Street. We tried the Waffle with berries, Duck Hash & Salmon. All of them were good. Would definitely like to try their bigger and better version- La Boucherie next time.
The dirty in the title doesn't reflect the venue. It's for the no frills, you get what you see. Good food-simple. Visited twice during our stay, some of the best guac I've had.
What a wonderful family run restaurant, food is truly amazing, with options for vegetarians. Good selection of curries, staff is very friendly

Complimentary champagne on arrival for our celebration - thank you!  We went for the a la carte - 2 starters (carpaccio and soup), 3 mains (duck, rabbit and lamb chop & shoulder) and 1 dessert (white chocolate).. for 2 of us.. we couldn't decide between 2 mains so got 3!  All of the food was great -especially the duck, so highly recommend this dish. Being in Czech Republic we wanted to try a Czech wine. A very different wine and not what we'd normally choose, but it did grow on me! Our waiter (light haired middle-aged guy - sorry I've forgotten his name!) was faultless. The service from all staff was fantastic. Very attentive and even offering other wine free of charge when we weren't keen on the Czech!  Thank you again for a wonderful evening! I would highly recommend Blue Wagon. Fantastic food, great service and great value for money!

They offer traditional Khmer food. Everything we order is amazing. The service is good. The place is very clean. Rith service is the best! We reccomend coming to this restaurant when you are in Siem Reap.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Delicious food in a lovely setting
review_data.review: Once we tried this restaurant we just kept coming back making our way through their delicious menu. We particularly liked the fresh spring rolls, the Pad Thai and eggplant with pork dish. The deserts are good too! Try for yourselves.

review_data.review_title: HIDDEN GEM YOU MUST GO TO
review_data.review: Hanoi food culture is really nice restaurant down a back Alley. I had pork do it yourself rice wraps. Yummy food and, the cocktails were also amazing. The staff were really nice and the food came super quick. Some had starters and desserts which were also very tasty. We were a table of 11 and very impressed with the service.

review_data.review_title: An after noon Vietnamese Lunch in Hanoi
review_data.review: The Vietnamese lunch was pretty interesting. The food was supplied in round plates from which we all helped ourselves . The food was good. The salad served was tasty. The ambience of restaurant was pretty cool and service was with a smile.
In general, good experience and tasty food. Batata Harra needs a lot of work, mussels also need some work. Shrimps were very nice as well as other grilled fish. Friendly staff and good prices

Very good restaurant, we have been there 3 times in a 6 day visit. The food was so good, there is no better place. We had 64° degree roasted filet of beef with peppercorn sauce. The wines are also fine. But the best is the service, special from the main waiter Rui, he was so kind in explaining the food and in wine selection. We also loved his grappa choices, which was a perfect meal ending. Thanks again Rui and hope to see you again. The 2 German guys.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: They have a nice variety of foods and their wait staff is so nice. Special thanks to Dale for being so kind. Highly recommend!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: Despite getting the worst table in the house (we had booked last minute) our dinner experience was excellent. Great service, well prepared & presented food & attractive understated surroundings. We enjoyed the dessert so much we returned for it the next afternoon.

The ambience is very relaxed and staff extremely friendly. This a modern decorated, small, cosy restaurant. I got billie- toasted bread with beet hummus and avocado and added a poached egg. My partner ordered the twist - pancakes with bacon, cheddar and fried egg. We were both delighted with our breakfast! The food is very tasty and their menu is well priced! Highly recommend it!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker

review_data.review_title: Fantastic, disappointed we can't get delivery to the UK!!!!
review_data.review: We went out of our way to visit Bleeker Street Pizza following reviews and we weren't disappointed. The slices were fantastic, the prices are reasonable.  Limited seating but it's size and family ownership, along with the pizzas, are what makes this please a must visit either if you are in Greenwich or, in our case, Battery Park!

user_data.user_tags: History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer

review_data.review: The food was really nice here, but I particularly want to mention the service here which was the best we had in Ubud. Lovely people with good food and the price was reasonable too.
The most perfect falafel ever and do try the pitta bread veg sandwich so gorgeous, the salad boxes also very tasteful as the tabbouleh is made on the day you do want to repeat.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover

review_data.review_title: The best Vegan and Palestinian food in town
review_data.review: Amazing food, this shop has the best taste food ever for Vegans and people like me that enjoys Mezze food. All so fresh and delicious super central to get to it.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Found this restaurant on First Table so decided to book it, we were not disappointed great food at a good price. The service was excellent and food delivered quickly. We decided to share 2 sides and a pizza all excellent. We went at 5PM only people there but within half an hour alot of tables in use, great to see. Would we go again..... definitely

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: Pleasant food in a lovely location with good service.
review_data.review: We stopped here for some lunch in the scorching heat. I have some veal and the wife had carbonara. Both were tasty without being large portions. Three different staff asked if we wanted desserts. It was decent food for a decent price.

review_data.review_title: We booked a table as it was No 1 on trip advisor.
review_data.review: Ble Wagon is a lovely resturant with great food, however our waiter was quite arrogant. We didn't get any bread or nibbles when other tables did, we had a lovely bottle of wine, and asked for it by the glass at the end of the meal. The bottle we had was a 2010, the glasses were 2008, the waiter said it was the same wine, I said it couldn't be as it was a different year, but he disagreed with me, which I thought was rude, plus the size of the glass he poured was very small, when other people were having wine their glasses were twice the size. As I said the food was fantastic and I would recommend it, but the service was disappointing.
Great value fixed price lunch $37 for three courses, lovely food great wine fantastic service, well recommended on trip advisor
Great service and fantastic food. Everything we ordered was delicious. The wine was outstanding! Must book ahead.
Excellent. Highly recommend. Great pasta. Service was very good. Authentic Italian food. Looking fwd to next visit.

No wonder that Thong Dee Is ranking number 1 in TripAdvisor. It is the best meal I had in Phuket (so far). Tenderloin was divined!! The cheese sauce that come with it was just delicious. Shrimp pesto and oysters are all great dishes. Rhubarb cake (sweet sponge cake together with rhubarb) is just amazing. Definitely worth a ride from Phuket city or Patong beach. Service is excellent as well as the food. Waiters and waitress are attentive.

review_data.review_title: Incredible steak - would absolutely eat here again
review_data.review: I think this may be one of the best steaks I’ve ever had.  Firstly, really nice location and restaurant is modern and clean.  Menu is fantastic and reasonably priced. Waiter made some brilliant recommendations. Steak was absolutely sensational. I can not fault it.  Wine was also on top form - the Malbec recommendation I had was brilliant.  I would highly recommend this place.

This restaurant has a nice garden atmosphere, complementing good food and positive staff.  The spring rolls I had were very tasty.  The only thing I'd note about this place is that the menu is quite limited. They focus on spring rolls, and I tried the ones I most wanted to try. So, less chance of a return visit than other places.  Reccomended.

review_data.review_title: I echo the strongly positive reviews here
review_data.review: Visited for a late lunch /early dinner on the basis of the good reviews on TA. A good decision. I'm sure I will return whilst I'm in SR.  I can reccomend the Salmon Tartare as well as the Pork Ribs. Good quality dishes.  Staff were great - positive and attentive.
I visited Try Me a few times whilst in SR. Good, simple food. Reasonably. Priced. Positive vibe from the staff. There is a reason I kept coming back - it was nearby and consistently good.

review_data.review_title: ATTN: Location wrong on Grab as at early Aug 22.
review_data.review: This restaurant has changed premises. When I got a grab there, it went to their old location. Fortunately it was a walk of only 8 minutes to the new location, but something to note. The location on Google Maps is Correct.  Had spring roll for starter.The appetiser options were mostly salads, so some additional variety would be welcome.  Beef for main which was very tasty and well presented.  Nice, simple, elegant decor.  Be aware that as at Aug 22 it's cash payment only.

review_data.review_title: Worth a visit if you are in Rawai
review_data.review: Visited Zen Eat for dinner on my last evening in Rawai. I went for the 990 baht gourmet menu as I really wanted to try the beef check and it made it good value to add an additional starter and main course.  Very impressed with the food, presentation, ambiance and the friendly staff.  The place was quite busy even with the current diminished tourist presence.

When we visited, there were two large parties downstairs so we settled in for a wait. We were told there would be a delay in our food arriving which was fine, we had time so made the choice to stay. Had a couple of really lovely cocktails and the OH had a large beer and an aperitif. We actually received our food pretty quickly and were so glad we decided to stay and wait. I had the Caesar burger, a patty with lettuce, croutons, Parmesan and delicious Caesar dressing. Hubby had bacon, cheese, rocket and caramelised onions with his. Both were absolutely delicious. Decent portion of good fries on the side. Really reasonably priced considering what we had and the quality. This place is a little off the beaten track although still really central. But it’s not somewhere you’d necessarily walk past on a tourist route. Search it out, I heartily recommend it. One of the best burgers I’ve had for a long long time.

We understand this restaurant is under new management - well they're certainly getting off to a good start. Service was excellent - food superb and the view.... well.... just wonderful. We were only in the city for 3 nights and discovered this place on the last night. If we'd have found it on the first then it would have been very hard not to eat there every evening as it was all just so very special.  Go and check it out - it's fantastic :)
