review_data.review_title: Service with warmth and amazing food
review_data.review: Super food and super service ...Juli you made our visit memorable. The salmon roll was gorgeous and the ambience also but the service made this dinner awesome.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review_title: Afternoon tea in the Park room
review_data.review: Afternoon tea was fantastic great food, tea, champagne and service.Attention to derail and Altay was a credit to the hotel. Good range of teas, finger and open sandwiches are perfect as was the Scones an cakes. Lovely surroundings with background piano playing the old favourites.

We have had dinner tonight at this amazing steak house, and I cannot wait to wright a review.  At fisrt, the place sends a message of being vibrant and cosy, with musiciens playing soft jazz and blues. As our experience started, service was precise and extremely attentive; the waiter was caring without excess but in a very simple and polite manner. Nothing different to expect from a restaurant one could say, however, experiences in NYC have not always showed the same. The quality of our dinner has been outstanding: we shared a starter - a crab cake- was extremely fresh and generous. The entree - a porterhouse for two- was perfectly served, at the right temperature, which is not easy when requesting beef to be bleu! Throughout our dinner, the presence and the eye of the owner - Mr Bruno Selimaj - never stopped being there, himself taking personal care of all guests well-being.  This is our seventh trip to NYC, without having being able to travel here in the past two years because of COVID, but Club A is an address we will keep in our minds for our next visit: a restaurant you must experience!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer

review_data.review_title: A great quant restaurant in NYC
review_data.review: For one of our company events, we rented out the restaurant starting at 3pm, and then had appetizers served as we held our meeting (and drinks). At the conclusion of the meeting, we moved to dinner. The service staff was excellent, always stopping by and seeing how we're doing. The food was great as well as the presentation of the food. And the restaurant was clean and had a great feel to it. There were two sides to the restaurant, and even though we rented out part of it, the other side was still able to sit about 10-12 tables. It's also at a great "and active" location so you can get a true feeling on NYC as you enjoy your dinner.

review_data.review_title: One of the best places to dine in Phuket
review_data.review: This restaurant is one of the best places to dine in Phuket. I was lucky to stay there during the pandemic for a few months. So this time I purposely return for their food, they serve tasty and flavorful dishes with some unique local ingredients and surprising twists. The service there is excellent and professional as always. This place is absolutely the one if you look for a causal Thai dining place with international standard, still offering full Thai tastes. The last thing you must order is dessert. They currently have good choices of sweet, however if you are lucky enough ask for Chef Fon to surprise you with her Thai dessert of the day. It’s off the menu. Chef Fon has real skills for Thai dessert that are not so easy to find these days. I just hope that the restaurant is going to add more of her sweets such as Tab Tim Krob in the menu. I would love to have it for my afternoon treat.  - Patrick

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: One of the best most authentic Indian dinners I've had in yeard
review_data.review: I've never made it to India. I tend to hold my authentic Indian dining experience against meals I've had in London. This place was delicious and as far as I can tell, the real deal. Went out as a group of friends, and we were truly the minority given the number of tables occupied by people obviously from India. So to me, that's always a sign of an authentic ethnic restaurant outside the actual country it is trying to represent.  As you enter the restaurant, there's a very small (6 person maybe) bar in a street level lobby. Then you go up a flight of stairs to the restaurant. The layout is spacious, open, and has windows at each end of the room which makes the space seem even larger.  The food was fantastic! The wait staff was the only reason I didn't give 5 dots. They were 'very good' too, but not always friendly (we had three different waiters). And although they have a liquor license, we weren't offered the wine list or drinks. We had to ask. Which may be cultural, I don't know. But it was a bit odd.  I will be back. And I will tell anyone I know who's traveling to the Times Square area who like Indian food to be sure to check this place out!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Good Food with a Quirky Touristy Ambiance
review_data.review: The food was good. If you’re into touristy ambiance, this is the place. The restaurant is decorated with eclectic items throughout. The food would’ve been better if the server didn’t insist on what we should order and how we should order. Having travelled in many places and eaten at many restaurants, I find it very annoying when server treats American as if we’ve never eaten foreign meals before. How foreign can steak really be!?!? I like the idea of the many different condiments and side items served with the meal on the first visit just to have the different tastes of flavors they offer but I wouldn’t care for it on my next visit. I would come here again but I would insist on ordering what I like rather than what the server insists. I would be more selective on the side items rather than many different items that I don’t care for. For dessert, I ordered a flan which was overwhelming even for 3 people. Flan is already very sweet but they served with large portion of dulce leche.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Chilling in a laid back environment
review_data.review: Went to have a drink and a snack before dinner, but was taken by the tasty springrolls, the juicy drinks and the basically great vibe. Hence we ended up,staying for a couple of hours feeding springrolls. Highly recommended.

Wifey found this on the internet. Reviews were good and we went. We were not disappointed. Excellent service and very good local food in a pleasant setting. We were on the rooftop, which we recommend. Nice jazzy music in the background makes room for a good conversation. Worth a visit.

review_data.review_title: Fantastic food, amazing value for money
review_data.review: $45 for succulent lamb and beautifully cooked scalloped potatoes to feed two good appetites for two meals. There's only one thing on the menu; lamb and potatoes. But Pedro's knows that it's doing! Both are packaged into a foil packed baking tray- easy to heat up at home. The lamb was falling off the bone and the potatoes were crisp on top and had soaked up some of that wonderful jus. Amazing meal to have at home. Pedros have upped the standard for takeaways.
Our hotel concierge recommended this restaurant, off the tourist streets in Prague. We could not have been happier. Fantastic food, great service, in a lovely warm atmosphere.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: We were recommended Chanrey from our tour guide. The service is very attentive and friendly. The menu is delicious. I had fresh spring rolls and green Thai curry seafood. My husband had the pineapple fried rice. All delicious. Highly recommended.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Beach Goer

review_data.review: Having looked on TA for a recommend Indian - we visited here. Being regulars to Phuket I was surprised I had not noticed the place. Set on a busy street it’s easy to walk past - but don’t! The food is very tasty and the owner -Pal - very friendly. We like spicy food but he even offered to let us try the different degrees of change to the food which was very impressive. Great flavours and super value - £35 - €42 for a starter and main each with a couple of beers each. Be warned the portions are very generous. Service was a little manic but we will definitely return

An old colonial era style house converted to a comfortable old style restaurant - elegant and calming. Is of the "closed door" variety so popular in BA so a reservation is required...  Food was lovely - small tasting dishes in a multi-course menu are probably the most interesting option. No huge hunks of meat here - dishes are all fairly delicate and of excellent size so you come away feeling satisfied but not stuffed.. The best bit is the wine pairings.. The owners are someliers/wine enthusiasts and offer a wine paring option with the menus where you can taste (copious, generous quantities) wines with each course; often 2 per course so that comparisons can be made... It's a really good intro to Argentinian wines for several different regions and grape varieties. And the price??? -- per head around U$D100....  Go. You won't be disappointed.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Don't eat anything before a visit here. Book as if they have a party in it fills up quickly. Big burger, fries, we had 2 beers 2 dips and onion rings. Bill was 900 krona. Fast service tasty food. We had one burger with pear and blue cheese and a vegetarian one the same.

This is a nice relaxed area. Its never really busy. We had 2 cocktails , they were nice but overpriced. £13 for one £15 for the other and nearly £3 service charge. we had cocktails in other places which were just as nice for half the price.

Came here while on holiday as it was close to where we stayed. Picked well food was good and tasty. We had 2 beers , water, one chicken pakora starter for hubby. He said it was fresh , most, chicken breast with a spicy sauce. Next one nan, one basmati rice, a chana masala side dish, a lamb pasanda and a mutter paneer. All very good, service swift and bill was 1300 Krona.

Visited on the recommendation of our tour director. Escorted from our hotel across the road to the entry path where we were greeted by a waiter from the restaurant. We decided to dine inside and not brave the external hammock style arrangement. Dining area somewhat sterile and lacking atmosphere although there is high quality decor throughout. Service a bit tawdry, took a while for drinks to be served, wines and a beer. Kitchen somewhat slow with meals but meal quality and presentation was excellent. I would consider the restaurant a fine dining experience with matching prices and will give an "excellent" rating based on the quality of the meals.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: Fred R Barnard, advertising executive, is credited with the saying that a picture is worth a thousand words. Well, I’ve been admiring the pictures of Big Boys Burger Club offerings for three years and finally put his claim to the test.  Sorry Fred, the picture simply doesn’t convey the explosion of taste in that first mouthful of juicy double stack burger that is the El Clasico, sheer burger bliss. I elected to have the patties cooked medium well, and the result was a juicy burger with two patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and the tomato aioli sauce. The Big Boy, another winner with the crispy bacon topping the patties. Toasted pineapple slices gave the Waikiki a different taste sensation and the Croc Dundee with the fried egg and beetroot was just an amazing meal. Mustn’t forget the onion rings and the ice cold Changs. My wife enjoyed her Blues Brothers (without the bun) and on other nights the chicken wings , chicken on green plate and those tasty chips.  There are still more gourmet creations to be sampled, another trip from OZ necessary, the YOLO remains a challenge to be tackled.  Great vibe in the restaurant, a warm welcome from staff and the elegant owner, impeccable unobtrusive service throughout. I’d recommend these burgers to anyone, they are just delicious taste combinations.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: this was a good experience, tasty food, great service, reasonable pricing. outstanding opportunity to meet friends or just visit and enjoy culinary

Not sure if we went on an off day, but our food was average at best. Ordered the popadoms and they had a burnt taste. The Onion Bhajis were probably the best thing we ate; they at least tasted ok. We ordered a Chicken tikka masala, tasteless. Chicken Korma, really odd minty taste, we didn’t finish it. A chicken Kadhai, med spicy as described, not much chicken and a Prawn Makhani, tasted like tomato soup and had 5 small prawns. Pesawari naan, looked good on the outside but was greasy and had a strange tomato flavour inside. Waiter was very polite but only cleared half the table and never returned until my husband went to the counter for the bill. Wanted to love it but all in all, we were all disappointed and wouldn’t return.
We had a meal here tonight it was fantastic. Everything was well presented, service was very good but not overwhelming. The chicken dish that I had was very flavoursome. It was a very good meal!

Had a delicious meal here the other night. Great welcome, we were taken to our table, which had lovely views over the bay. Service was very good,but not intrusive. The food was delicious, my other half had the sea bass which he said was really tasty, I had the chicken dish, which I really enjoyed, it had a really tasty sauce with it. We had a side dish of zucchini which was amazing.

This place is amazing, from the moment you set foot in the place you are treated so well. We went on a very humid evening, we were advised to stay inside, good recommendation. Our waiter was so helpful, and very calm. The food when it arrived was delicious. We are fortunate enough to be going again this week. Fantastic restaurant.
The menu was varied and the food was delicious. The steak was the best I had in Argentina and wine glasses were refilled fairly regularly. An enjoyable evening and a great dinner.

review_data.review_title: Very good; pity it has not Italian sphere
review_data.review: Nice restaurant! Nice menu, nice location, decoration. Service is fast. Waiters are Ok but neither Portuguese-speaking nor Italians, which does not help the sphere. Clients are a mix of locals and tourists. But food was quite good... And I go to a restaurant to eat. I will definitely come back!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Very popular local restaurant. Book your table!
review_data.review: We ate dinner here. It’s a cozy restaurant in Firostefani and an alternative to the caldera view restaurants because it relies on ambience and food more than caldera views. Certainly a very welcoming and helpful host and this place is rightly popular. We had booked in advance and that was a good job because there were many ad hoc visitors who had to be turned away as it was fully booked. The food is very homely and of a good standard. I am not sure where many reviewers below have dined but I would not consider the food rates as highly as many have described. Obviously tastes vary. We found it a very pleasant alternative though to many other places we visited in Santorini and it certainly comes at a significantly lower cost than pretty much anywhere with the view out over the caldera. Well worth a visit . But don’t forget to book, they are very helpful

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Enjoy attentive and lovely service in a Morrocan atmosphere
review_data.review: We came accross this small snack house when wandering through the medina. They invited us to come in and we were not disappointed. They offer a good variety on the menu. Quite a lot of vegetarian options as well. Good juices and a nice taste for a very reasonable price. Also the entourage - both the rooms as well as how they serve the dishes - is more than just a snack bar. They also have a floor upstairs but we didn't check that out as it is much more fun to stay close to the street where things happen. The staff is polite, multi-lingual (French, Spanish as well as English) and attentive. This is certainly a good stop for a small meal.

Great Turkish food, fantastic service and friendly staff. Located close to the sultanamet area it is perfect if you are visiting or your hotel is near by. Prices are reasonable and kitchen opened all day  Fantastic I veritable menjar turc, servei genial i personal molt amable. Situat a prop de la zona de sultanamet, és perfecte si esteu de visita o el vostre hotel és a prop. Els preus són raonables i la cuina oberta tot el dia

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: Have been coming here for few years now and this place is just unbeatable.  They serve one of the best cheese burgers in the world & point à la ligne. The steak tartare is out of this world a must try...  The success story behind il Etait Un Square are the staff and the owners.  Love love love will be back soon.

review_data.review_title: Excellent Food and decent size portions
review_data.review: If you are staying at the Renaissance you MUST eat here! In fact even if you are not staying here it is worth a visit. The restaurant is small so reservations are necessary as it gets busy. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the view is lovely over the water. The menu has some Thai traditional dishes but also some not so well known ones and the Grouper with three sauces is our favourite. It comes filleted and has amazing flavours. We ate here twice and if we were here another day we would have been back for a third day. Definitely one of the highlights of staying at this hotel. Do not miss it!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Always Good Food and Atmosphere here.
review_data.review: We were staying at the JW Marriott and have eaten at the Ninja restaurant before so could not wait to come back. Rinnie our server was so helpful and kind. She helped us with the menu and recommended options. We took advantage of the Marriott Bonvoy set menu which was wonderful value and a good selection of food and would highly recommend. The food quality here was excellent and the service good.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We were not staying at there Marriott this tike but having experienced the Buffet Meals here before we decided to make a special journey for the Thais Street Food Buffet. The buffet selection was amazing and was constantly kept stocked up and freshly cooked. The staff were happy to make recommendations and to cook special requests such as noodle. The quality oft he food is excellent. The buffet meals at there Marriott Cafe are well worth a visit but be careful as during low season they are few and far between. They have different themes and in my experience they are all great value. Good for families and they always have child friendly dishes available.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: Lovely meal. Large portions and very filling. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good selection of food. Good value. Lovely atmosphere and child friendly. Large open window at front so nice to sit in on warm day.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: Lovely little restaurant tucked up a side street about 300m from the Mouline Rouge. With a Mexican chef the cuisine is fresh and served promptly. Home brewed beer is on the menu and all of the food is served in tapas style portions with an excellent range to pick from. We particularly enjoyed the fillet beef special and the salmon with fresh lime juice and coriander. Would highly recommend a visit here and would definitely eat here again. One of the hidden Gems in this area of Paris.

Amazing $10 deals for lunch. The Margarita Pizza was amazing, service was solid and the chef kept us happy. Much appreciated relaxing lunch after our Nevis Swing ... honestly we also really need a couple of adult beverages.

Craving for Indian food after 3 days of burgers we stumbled upon this gem of a place. The ambience looks pricey but prices are very reasonable. Food is fresh and taste awesome. The chicken tandoori , lamb dishes are 1 of the best. Nothing taste like its been thawed from the freezer. Food is also very gentle on the stomach and very well cooked. Top marks for the chef. The waiters need to be more humble in their approach and a smile and less seriousness definately will add more spice to this superb restaurent. Thank You for your "home cooked meals ".

Waited while our room was being cleaned. Limited beer selection, all bottles, no tap. Menu was limited...salads and sandwiches - approx $13. Beer and food were good, service was excellent. Nice little reprieve.

This is always more of an event than a place per se. This is my third trip to Buenos Aires and third time visiting this special secret dining room in 16 years. The food is always exceptional and creatively prepared using fresh regional ingredients. Each of 5 courses is described in detail and paired with thoughtfully chosen wines. The chef is incredibly knowledgeable of wines and the stories behind them. His background in some of the best restaurants in New York City offers an interesting perspective. If the food and beverage were not enough, the interactions and friendships made with the guests takes the experience over the top. Everything about the timing and the interactions and the flow of the evening has always seemed to be “just the right amount of everything“. Bravo! (Get there soon as the chef is technically retired but still doing these special events on occasion.)

review_data.review_title: Truly the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires
review_data.review: We had a fantastic time from the moment we arrived. The description of what to expect was precisely accurate. We really enjoyed meeting the other guests but the food was the star of the show. Every dish was attractively presented and absolutely delicious. The portions were perfect if not slightly large but everything was seasoned to perfection. The chef Dan brings vast food knowledge from years of experience, research, and from being a food writer. This is such a special experience that I strongly suggest you book it in advance as to not be disappointed if trying to do so after you arrive in Buenos Aires. When available, Dan also provides food-oriented day tours. We were lucky to spend a full day with him and it enriched our experience immensely as he has lived there for almost 20 years. His Spanish and English are perfect and he speaks several other languages.

We came leaded by Tripadvisor and it did Not let us down. Refined food in an elegant environment. Outstanding service. We did an onLine reservation on their website in the same afternoon and they got it all under control.
The restaurant is very good and we really enjoyed the show. Staff is very nice and attentive. Good reception. Special thanks to Mew (Nhev) for her outstanding service.

review_data.review_title: Great Khmer Food at very reasonable prices
review_data.review: This is a new Siem Reap restaurant recommenced to us by a local. Offering Khmer street food with a twist, plated like a 5 star restaurant.  Started with the Siem Reap Platter for 2, followed by Prawn Salad & Battambang sausage. All really tasty. Also had a “fresh & tasty” cocktail which was superb and the Australian Chardonnay was also good  We ate early (6.30) so were the only ones there.  Service was great, with each dish explained by Nab the owner, and he introduced the two other staff on that night doing the cooking.  This is our 3rd visit to Siem Reap so we have eaten at a lot of places. Will definitely be going back to this one.

A really nice lunch to celebrate my chums 60th birthday. The service was outstanding and food very good. My only criticism was that the pasta was a little over cooked. Guinea fowl was very nice and we had a great wine
Fantastic fresh Salmon brunch which sorted the hangover right out especially with the smooth coffee. Everybody loved the food and managed to fit all 10 of us in. Amazing place would return

review_data.review_title: Great cocktails. Great fun. Great staff
review_data.review: With our stay at the Radisson Blu we received credit for the bar and restaurant, so we used ours in Be Bop bar.  Before I talk about the drinks, I want to talk about the staff. We sat at the bar for 3 nights, and on two nights were attended to by Honza (I hope that’s his name). Sure - you can just drink the drinks for theatre and get drunk and fall off your bar stool.  But what we learned over 3 nights is just how much time, energy, intelligence and creativity goes into the formulation of the recipes AND the ingredients that go into them. They make many of their own ingredients, and the processes take a long time and a lot of care and skill.  Now, to the cocktails.  They are unique, fun, beautifully balanced and well worth trying. I won’t say much about them, but if you want to sit at a bar, dressed in a laboratory coat and a safety mask, while a cocktail basically explodes in front of you, this is the place to go!  As well as their own list of house cocktails, they’ll make pretty much any cocktail you suggest.  BRILLIANT!

A slightly odd menu that’s a mixture of pasta and local dishes. Good roof terrace. Friendly service. Alcohol if you want to pay for the option. My issue is that my tagine was, at best, luke warm - though it was tasty.

The food was amazing. I went for the more spicy option and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were simply awesome. I got to try out a new dessert on the house which was quite nice. I highly recommend this place.

review_data.review: Very good Indian restaurant, the food was awesome and very satisfying. The only thing though was that in the menu, it said Coke, I ordered it, I got a Pepsi, you don't do that, it really threw me off, Coke is always better, if it says Coke on the menu, then you should serve Coke. This is the reason why this restaurant won't get an excellent from me.

review_data.review: Varied menu and very tasty food indeed. Staff were attentive, restaurant was clean, organised and service was quick. Food really tasty and even took what I couldn't finish home with me in a box. Would recommend if you want something different to make a change from steak and burgers

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Very good moment in FLO dubai with my Girls Amazing view on Burj Khalifa The food and Mocktail is very good thznsk FLO Dubai

We booked the lunch offer and were very happy with the food, atmosphere and value for money. The restaurant is very nice, divided into different rooms which gives a spacious yet intimate feel. The service throughout was professional but not stuffy or pretentious. I ordered orange wine and I was advised to try it as it was an acquired taste - too true I didn’t like it and we had an interesting conversation about it! It was swiftly replaced with merlot. The food from the 3 course menu was nicely presented with some humorous touches and the portion sizes were perfect. I’d definitely recommend lunch here and I’d go back Thank you to the staff

Went for dinner here at the start of May, very nice greeting on getting out the car with a cold towel service and personal escort to the restaurant.- so far so good. The swing seating is also quite an eye opener - Elegant, playful, brings a real element of 'occasion' to dining there.  Things started well, but a lack of detail started to emerge once the dining service got under way. The bottle of white wine we ordered was cool not cold upon opening and wasn't at it's proper temperature from the cooler until the last glass; My dining companion ordered the $31 tasting menu whilst I went a la carte.  Their serving procedure was to serve half of the tasting menu dishes in one go, to link with my starter course, and then serve the other half of the tasting menu all in one go again when my main course was served. Never experienced this in our collective lives, and we've seen how it's done in Thai restaurants in Bkk with different orders so it isn't a particular regional practice to cram up tasting menu courses to match an a la carte one. My companion ended up sending some dishes back to hold, to allow her to finish one course without letting the other dishes get cold and of course to concentrate on one set of flavours at a time. Most disappointed.  To be fair, the food was decent, I enjoyed my courses - had a lovely tofu tempura for starters (it was a main from their vegetarian menu) and soft shell crab for mains. All really well made and seasoned. Oh, except the rice - Cold rice. In SE Asia, that's almost heresy.  Service was too variable for comfort - As well as the above, our servers would either swarm around, or disappear - getting the bill at the end required catching the eye of one waiter who Pointed to another one who nodded, who came by a few minutes later to ask what we wanted.  It was too strange, at such variance to our normal experience in SR (and even at the very same restaurant where I'd eaten lunch last year). What made it go from a "let's chalk this up to bad chance" to "this really isn't acceptable" was that dinner including modest wine, and service ended up at $110 - By far the most we'd paid for food in SR, including at the fabulous Cuisine Wat Damnak.

review_data.review: When you enter this trattoria, you feel like you are transported to the Mediterranean in the ❤️ of Greenwich Village. Classic Italian dishes with a focus on house-made pastas, hand-stretched pizzas and more. I had their flavorful "Polipo Alla Grilla" which consisted of tasty grilled octopus, pureed cannellini beans, crushed potatoes and olives/capers.  Save room for dessert. Their dark chocolate panna cotta with fresh berries was heavenly. Service was friendly and efficient.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: My last day lunch here lasts a very good memory. I miss Kroya's food so much. The best Fish Amok! And you have to try their Royal Khmer Crudite with Pork & Krill Dip.It may looks very simple but taste really good. Will be back one day :)

Visiting Prague with friends and this restaurant was recommmended. We were not disappointed. Great menu and various choices from a la carte and degustation menu with wine pairings. Food cooked to a very high standard and excellent service. Great selection of local wines and knowledgeable sommelier. Recommend highly.

I went for dinner at Numero 28 after finding out it was the best rated pizzeria on Tripadvisor. my waiter, Guiseppe, was very nice and friendly. I ordered the Numero 28 and it was simply excellent. I'd like to say that I am a huge pizza fan and this was definitely one of the best I have ever eaten.

Went here for a quick bite to eat for lunch and chose this restaurant because of the reviews - we were not disappointed. The service is impeccable and the food very tasty. We ordered Hanoi spring rolls (you must order these - so tasty!), pork skewers and chicken noodles and all were very tasty. Would recommend going here as they also serve an little appetiser and complimentary dessert which was delicious!

review_data.review_title: One of the best restaurants we have eaten in
review_data.review: The setting for this restaurant was very, very nice. The Moroccan food was some of the best we have had while in Morocco. We especially liked the salad. The tajines with the vegetables was very delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Nice place this. Friendly staff, good menu and decent wine. Lots of attention to presentation of food, which was delicious. Few things that could be improved - music (80s eg Whitney Houston, Lionel Richie, Tapau I think?!) and bright lighting which was more in keeping with a cafe than a restaurant into the detail. But I'd be surprised if you didn't walk out happy. A safe bet for dinner and good value for money too.

review_data.review: Not your typical restaurant. An oasis of fun and calm, very laid back. Comfortable seating, live music at night... a solo singer doing the old rock classics. The menu never seems to change, but a good mix of items. We loved the soups... both the taco and crab... order a cup... the bowl didn't seem like much more. Loved the avocado, the coconut shrimp, the chicken entree. Wine by the glass reasonable for NYC. Service was excellent.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We like the food here. Service can be erratic. On this visit the front of the restaurant was sectioned off for a private holiday party. Needless to say they were enjoying their cocktails and were very loud. This impacted our leisurely dining experience in a negative way. I believe when restaurants decide to take large parties that will impact the "regular" diner, they should accommodate the other patrons in some way... a drink, dessert, something to acknowledge the inconvenience... not just think it's ok.  Our coconut shrimp, crab cakes, salads, and the taco soup were very good. Chicken and Tuna entrees were enjoyed by all. The cold mashed potatoes served with the chicken were happily replaced.  Wines and drinks were very good.  Not our best meal here but still like the restaurant. Service needs improvement and ask about parties that may be booked... I guess it will calm down after the holidays but still beware.

Definitely feel like you're in an island setting, on vacation or something. We liked everything we had... duo (guac, cheese) with chips, coconut shrimp, taco soup. Love their chicken dish, the ribs, mahi mahi. Don't miss the key lime pie. Great bartender here as well.

review_data.review: My kids and I were staying in Chinatown looking for great Xiao Long Bao (soup dumplings) so we stopped at Shanghai Asian Cuisine. Terrific dumplings and terrific prices. We ordered 1 order per person and some fried rice. Food was tasty and cheap. Cash only!
I went there with a family according to the good reviews on TripAd, and we were not deceived at all. Food is excellent and well presented. Better going there before eight at night.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We visited Manzil La Tortue for their pool day and lunch, which is excellent value. For 290DH we got two delicious courses each, and use of the pool all day - this also included towels and a late afternoon snack.  The food was absolutely delicious - some of the best we had in Marrakech - and the service went above and beyond. We were there celebrating my birthday and my partner was able to arrange a bottle of champagne with the owner, which they didn't have on their wine list. Nothing was too much trouble and we had a fantastic day.  One thing to note, the pool isn't heated, but that actually makes for a welcome respite from the hot sunshine. It really is a tranquil environment and a fabulous place to have a relaxing day. If we had known about Manzil La Tortue when we were booking our accommodation, we would have definitely booked to stay there. Highly recommended.  Top tip: If you wish to do their pool and lunch day and you're staying in central Marrakech, call up and book their transfer service (costs 150DH each way) to avoid the inevitable haggling with the taxi driver once you arrive!
The best place to have breakfast in Alfama - they may look super simple, but the scrambled eggs were the best scrambled eggs I've ever eaten. Fab place.

review_data.review_title: Very good, not the best in NYC
review_data.review: Overall, very good Neapolitan pizza. Slightly expensive. Crust was on the bland side and did not have that certain flavor when 00 flour is utilized. Slightly disappointed with seating. Went early and did not have a reservation. Plenty of tables available and was given worst outside table available.

Best pizza in NYC! Crust is light and tasty; fior di latte mozzarella, sweet and creamy; sauce just sweet enough; cooked to perfection. Restaurant is small and tight, but definitely worth the visit if you want outstanding Neapolitan pizza. No need for toppings, just get the margherita with the fior di latte mozzarella.

review_data.review_title: Almost as good as pizza from Napoli
review_data.review: Had the margherita pizza and it reminded me of the pizza I had in Naples. Fresh tomato, basil and tasty mozzarella. Crust was a little chewy, but flavorful. Pizza s are "12 and on the expensive side. Consider a margherita pizza in southern Italy is around $4, the pizza at motorino is $15. Overall, true italian pizza, but on the expensive side.

review_data.review_title: Not bad to have a drink!
review_data.review: It is late and you are staying at the Hilton, good place to have tapas and a glass of wine, It is price and no atmosphere!

review_data.review_title: Best dining experience in Prague by far
review_data.review: We liked the sound of this place on TripAdvisor and so booked via email. We were seated at the counter where we could see everything freshly prepared to order. All that we ordered (wine and food) was outstanding. The service was friendly and informative. We had some great dining experiences in Prague however, this was by far the best.

We have been here three times - twice for tapas and drinks at the bar in the evening and once for brunch. Happy hour is good value and the food is delicious. The staff are very friendly and upbeat. Love the decor and spaciousness. Generous wine servings! Brunch was probably forgettable and they were almost empty while other restaurants nearby were overflowing so perhaps they need to rethink the brunch offerings.

I’m from Italy (really) and I really like good tasty but not to heavy pizza. Now this is the place! In addition outstanding service, familiar but not extravagant, warm, cordial with cosy and very nicely decorated ambient, ideal for both couples or for family gatherings. Service is perfect and all areas of the restaurant are clean and tidy. You can see that is properly run and always under the control of the owners who wore me welcome you at any occasion.

review_data.review: This place is the real deal; fantastic food, fantastic service and great value. The owner and his wife were so nice and we enjoyed every dish - starters, kleftiko and several fish main courses. This how Cypriot restaurants in London used to be. Can't wait to go back.

cool urban place. The restaurant is not very big, so it's very important to make a reservation! good food and the hamburgers are very big! The prices are not that high. It's good for a quick bite with the lads, not for a romantic dinner with your wife ;)

Just a short walk from the City Travelodge and I heartily recommend you get your breakfasts at this cafe. Lovely and efficient staff serve up a fine menu including all the breakfast favourites. Top quality ingredients at very keen prices for London. So good I went all three mornings of my stay. Opens Sundays too which is a bonus. Easily in my top all time cafes.

review_data.review: Once more referred to Trip Adviser to recommend restaurants in Marrakesh and was not disappointed with the visit to Dar Chef. The entrance was a bit confusing but once in, there was plenty of comfortable seating. The interior was unusual in structure, possibly a courtyard but now with a covered roof. The staff were all polite, efficient and cheerful. We chose the 3 course menu, excellent value at 80dh per person. The soup was hearty and the main tagine courses were piping hot and tasty. We finished the meal with fruit and mint tea. Would recommend this restaurant to any visitors to the city.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Searched Trip Adviser for restaurants in Marrakesh and decided to try Cuisine de Terroir. We were certainly not disappointed and would recommend this place to any visitor who wishes to taste authentic Moroccan food. Found the restaurant easily even though it’s situated within the Medina. The open interior is basically but comfortably furnished. The staff including the proprietor were all friendly, polite and efficient. English was spoken by all. The food was delicious. We had the tagine of beef, prunes and almonds / very tender and tasty and the chicken pastilla / sweet and fragrant. Moroccan sweets were ordered to complete the meal. The meal was value for money. An excellent choice.

Amazing little tapas bar. Great warm toddies and the BEST live music. We went to their Sunday sesh. The guys playing were fantastic. We did go in on Saturday but too crowded for us. Great service. Highly recommend the Sunday sesh.

We went to this restaurant because of the amazing reviews and we were glad we did. The reviews don’t lie! The staff was very friendly from beginning to end, we felt very welcomed immediately. We had a reservation and the table was ready when we arrived. The food was fantastic. I ordered the salmon and was amazing. My husband ordered the steak and he said it was ok, a little under done, even though he asked medium well. I guess that’s the way the cook in Paris. But the real champion of the evening was the dessert. We shared a Creme brûlée. It was unbelievable. Best dessert ever! And the price wasn’t expensive. We had very mediocre dishes in Paris and we paid almost the same price. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

review_data.review: We were looking for a nice restaurant to go to for dinner after our visit to the Javits Center and we were pleasantly surprised with this very nice place. A few blocks from the Javits Center it was an oasis in the neighborhood. Very good service from the moment we walked in to the last goodbye at the door, they couldn't have been nicer.  The food was Great, we shared 2 appetizers and we each had a main and the presentation for each dish was wonderfull, the flavors were pleasant and a bit different, but all were great.  All in all we had a fine time.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We really enjoyed the food during our last visit. We also recommended it to a Czech client of my husband and she was satisfied - lamb was the favourite We're definitely coming back with more friends to try "eat all you can" for lunch I just think the place is not suitable for parents with stroller bec. you have to go down the stairs.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: It is true that you get what you pay for. While this restaurant has prices that might be slightly higher than some other Italian restaurants here, the food is fabulous and it was one of the best meals I have had so far on this trip (I've been in Budapest, Vienna and now Prague). I ordered the meat ravioli in tomato sauce. It was very good, obviously homemade, and presented perfectly. Then, there was the pistachio semifreddo which was so yummy it makes you want to lick the plate! Our waiter (George) was attentive, friendly and so pleasant to chat with. We ate inside as the evening was a bit cool and seeing the light play off the Bohemian crystal chandeliers in the dining room was lovely. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a non-touristy place to eat which has a great menu selection. We are definitely going to go back before we leave Prague.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Great little place to visit with friends for a drink. The cocktail menu is exciting and the cocktails themselves do not disappoint. Great atmosphere and reasonably priced.

If I should describe the restaurant with just one word, it would be: Perfect! The interior, the atmosphere, the staff and not least the service and the food ... Perfect. We had a four courses seasonal meal with wine menu and we were extremely satisfied. I can only recommend this place!

I am giving this 4 stars because of the wonderful service. However in my experience the food was disappointing. This trip I am trying to eat a bit healthier ordering vegetable plates along with steak. The vegetables were overcooked and visually unappealing. The salad I ordered was drenched with way too much salad dressing. When I arrived the restaurant was empty but when leaving it was full.

It has been 10 years since my last visit to Buenos Aires and Casa Saltshaker was on my must do list. It was just as much an incredible experience as I remembered in my previous three visits. Each time I have been I have really enjoyed visiting with other guests from around the world. Even though I am not the most social person, I have felt very comfortable with this experience. Dan and Henry make everyone feel at home. The food is superb and the wine pairings are excellent. In addition it is a great place to share your current travel experiences and obtain excellent advice and recommendations.
On an 11 day trip I tried many parillas. Food and service were very good and I was able to walk here from my hotel near the Oblisque. Prices reasonable.
Enjoyed petting their friendly cats. Had a delicious coffee ice mountain. Huge portion large enough to share. Super friendly staff.
Wonderful. Lemon grass is used for a very unique straw for drinks. Food and service are excellent. Delicious soup and roasted eggplant with pork. Can’t wait to return to try other dishes.

Lots of really good restaurants on Tapul road and this is one of them. Great prices, selection and quality, I had the chicken cordon bleu and it was delicious. Huge portion and great value. Service is excellent

The food: cooked on a salt block from Pakistan the fish or meats. I had the snapper which was beautifully cooked and presented. Location with a view of the ocean is breathtaking. Get there at least 30 minutes before sunset to enjoy the view of the water. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor they do have fans and cover from the rain. Or, have a drink at the bar - good view also of the sea and yummy drinks (I had Fire on Ice...rum delicious!) Ask them to give you a buggy ride on the grounds at night...the lighting is not to be missed. It’s a beautiful resort. Tip: they have a Tree House bar. We didn’t have time to get this is but looks really cool. You can walk over from the Marriott via the beach or take a buggy. Can be a bit hard to find from the road especially. Hope you enjoy this evening. Only drawback is the service (i.e. presenting the menu) is not good. Probably not comfortable with their English. Otherwise it’s just fine!

review_data.review_title: Fab cocktails in a nice garden setting
review_data.review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

review_data.review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

review_data.review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review_data.review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

review_data.review_title: Good Service, But Very Limited Choices and High Prices
review_data.review: Good- but overrated… We looked forward to our dinner at Pur , but were disappointed in the menu. There were only four entrées to choose from and one was a cheese platter. The other entrée choices were sea bass , wyagu beef and sweet breads. My husband wanted none of them however he chose the wyagu beef. The sauce for the beef was excellent and he enjoyed it however at €135 it should be more than very good . I ordered the Seabass and found it adequate. The risotto with curry that came with the beef also had an excellent sauce. Some of the servers, including James and Amin, were very good. Leopold never brought the citrus vinaigrette I requested and seemed to completely forget it. He also had to be asked to serve us bread. There were many “extras” that were provided at no charge,but being very gourmet,required a receptive palate. I loved the artichoke appetizer bite with curry,but my husband didn’t care for any of them. We ordered a la carte,but with a €90 bottle of wine ( which was the least expensive Bordeaux on the menu) and coffee, our bill before tip was €333. We are world travelers and have stayed at some of the best hotels. Overall, I would give the food a B-. My husband gave it a much lower rating than that. If we had ordered the six course fixed menu with wine, the bill would have been well over €600. You would have had the same four entrees as well. Interesting experience, but we would never go back.

review_data.review_title: Don’t waste your NYC dining experience here
review_data.review: One star. The only reason for one is for the ambiance - the decor is very nice, especially on the outside area. Outside of that, our service was abysmal. Not one time did our server ask how our food was, if we wanted another drink, if we would like to see a dessert menu, or if he could get us anything else. If he would have asked any of these questions we would have told him that the octopus appetizer we ordered was beyond bland. - no salt, no seasoning and the so called grilled octopus had no char and tasted like it had been sitting in muck for so long that the skin was slimy and fatty, like we were just chewing on gelatin - inedible. Our entree, which was just the simple burger, was fine, and that's all. Cooked perfectly, thankfully, but again not much to it. The frites that came as the side were hard as rocks from being over cooked. The wine, cab for me, Pinot for my husband were bitter and tart and we would have liked to have sent them back, but for the server never saying a word to us for the entire meal - he didn't even bring us our food or drinks. We cannot understand how this restaurant has any good reviews.

Certainly the best restaurant in category VALUE FOR MONEY. You are best sticking to Tajines and Couscous. All are excellent and the portions are really big. Salads are good too - the Pastilla was unfortunately very dry. The Brochettes were somewhat disappointing as the seemed to come out of the deep fryer. The guys in service do an excellent job. Efficient an friendly. If you stick to the good dishes you won’t be disappointed.
Spent one night here and enjoyed it. If you‘re in the area it‘s worth checking out and have some nice drinks.
We came here for the cocktails. And we have not been disappointed. They not only look great - they taste good as well.
Agus, Desi and Putri will help you perfectly in your choice of a nice Indonesian meal. Good service and a nice price.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nightlife Seeker

review_data.review: The first general impression is the very quiet atmosphere of the Hyatt hotel lobby, a very charming, peacefull ambience when you just arrive from the chaotic traffic of Paris... We arrived a bit early, then we were invited to wait at the Hotel lounge, I recommend to go outside, there is a nice outside courtyard, we had a nice apperitif... The Pur restaurant was a great experience, we selected the 6 courses menu, I would recommend it, the 8 courses looks a bit too much, but that's only my opinion. We also selected the wine recommendation proposed in the menu.... There was a nice course after course experience and tasting... The service was perfect and very professional. We felt that it was going a bit too fast, we informed them and they adjusted. The kitchen is opened, you can see and feel the activity of the team, without disturbing the cosy atmosphere. The "Sommelier" was very professional, explaining in detail each wine and the relation with the meal. I really recommend the "Pur" , a nice gourmet experience in paris.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: Dar Moha is simply beautiful. If the setting wasn't enough, the food is outstanding. We had the 14 light salads (pre-starter) which were delicious! There is almost too much food to try but all dishes were delicious. I then opted for the sea bass tagine which was a delight, and then the sorbet dessert. The wine was also exquisite. The ambience was helped by a sitar player in the far corner of the restaurant, and later followed by a pair of traditional Moroccan musicians. The restaurant is beautiful; the staff attentive and helpful. Would recommend everyone visits Dar Moha when in Marrakech. It's an absolute treat.

This was one of our favorite places for dinner during our visit - we had dinner here three nights.  The food and service - especially the service, were A+. The gentlemen were always welcoming, ensuring all guests were taken care of, even if they were waiting to be seated. Welcome smoothies and smiles each time. On that note - do make reservations as you may be turned away if they're fully booked which was almost every night.  Tagine and couscous were some of the best we had. Prices are super reasonable, portions are more than enough, and their whiskey (Moroccan mint tea) was always yummy.  Pay them a visit!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: We arrived in happy hour and had a few drinks before ordering food. The menu was very good and I opted for prawns. Very good. We were going to stay longer but the music was turned too loud for us. We have since had a very sincere apology from the owner, apparently it was a new member of staff and I am assured it won’t happen again. I would certainly return and recommend this bar.

Five of us were very happy with our meal here. The menu is extensive, the food was consistently excellent and the service was friendly. Though not cheap by Istanbul standards, at $80 for five people, it was ludicrously affordable by Western standards. Added bonus: friendly cats climbing through the window.

Loved the atmosphere. Service here is outstanding. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Special thanks to K.Rainy, K.Jiji, K.Nam and K.Ann for taking good care of us. Great quality of food. Andaman Seafood Platter is highly recommended. So fresh and delicious - it was served with a sizzling Himalayan salt brick which made the food taste even better! Wagyu rib-eye was great too but we ordered medium-well, it turned out rare and bloody but truffle sauce really goes so well with it. The restaurant is located inside Anantara Mai Khao Villas so the price is sure to be expensive, but it is worth to spoil yourself once in a while.

This is an amazing restaurant set in a quiet and tranquil area only five minutes drive from Patong. The owners of this business take great pride in serving the freshest and most enjoyable food available on the island and their personal touch has contributed to making this one of Phuket's most popular places to dine. I enjoyed lunch there the other day and had an amazing experience which included a range of tasty Thai dishes. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this restaurant to any of my friends and family visiting the island.

Stephan was an attentive, knowledgeable and friendly member of the service team. He saw to us from the moment we arrived straight through to departure and gave excellent recommendations on both food and drinks. The food was incredible. Tbone steak and lobster meal with chips was 10/10 cooked to medium perfection (for me at least) and the cocktails were really delicious. However if you like strong cocktails you may want to ask for an extra shot. But other than that, this place was a good find, and hopefully you get to meet stephan who will add to your experience in a positive way.

review_data.review_title: A must if you're in the area
review_data.review: After spending a few days in Istanbul the restaurants can start to feel a bit similar - both in terms of menu and atmosphere. However Garden Mezze felt like a bit more of 'an occasion' compared to some of the other tourist focused places in the area. It is probably a little more expensive than some others - but not by a great degree and the setting, atmosphere, service, and food meant we didn't mind.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Had a late lunch in this quite tiny place. Very charming environment, with a pleasant service even if we were not in the normal lunch hours (arrived at 3PM). The food was excellent, I took the Cordon Bleu which was very good. The wildgoulasch from the suggestion was also excellent. Definitely a place to go back.

we discovered Chez Yassine on our visit to Marrakech last year and loved it so much we went back there 3 times on our visit in January. The food is so tasty and brilliant value for money. You get free bread olives and dips and the dips are always really tasty. The staff are lovely and friendly. A great place to eat
We had a lovely leisurely lunch in the garden area. The food was good value and all cooked fresh, even the crisps! The homemade desert was amazing! A great little find.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Loved this place...we went here a few times over our holiday and the mulled wine and cocktails are amazing.  We only had snacks here but they were also good (I think they’re made by neighbouring restaurants) but fast and tasty anyway.  Staff were really friendly and service was fast.

the bar is amazing I could have spent all day there, sitting taking in the stunning views from the Bosphorus and the rest of Taksim and the surrounding city. Very comfortable and relaxing. I didnt eat there but after looking at the menu it looks like you'd have some brilliant options if you were.

Such a lovely place, such a tasty breakfast. I absolutely falled in love with this place. The only think I missed was a bigger choice of cold soft drinks (eg home made ice tea). The rest was fabulous.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Amazing piece of meat and service!
review_data.review: The best steak I have ever eaten, period! The filet is 10 oz and was so tender and flavorful that I was in steak heaven. The Club A is a dining experience that you have to try if you are in the mood for a steak. The staff will treat you like family and Bruno the owner will come by your table to chat and check to make sure everything is to your liking. This is the second time I have eaten there and both times did not disappoint. I highly recommend this steak house as you will truly have a magical experience.

This is a wonderful pastry and coffee shop, training and employing young people and giving them the chance of employment and a better life. It lies down a leafy lane, in the quite Taphrun Village area, just off Taphrun Road. It's a quiet haven amid the noise of downtown Siem Reap.  The almond croissant, mango tart and chocolate marble cake we enjoyed were blissful. It's probably the best almond croissant I have ever tasted! The staff are delightful, the ambience is peaceful and soothing and the cakes, pastries and drinks divine. I highly recommend this coffee shop.

Had dinner on the weekend in this nice restaurant which was playing hoast to a party of perhaps 14 people including two very loud and rambunctious boys. The group made up more than half the dinner guests so I think the staff was hesitant to say anything to the oblivious parents. It is an expensive and nice restaurant by Hanoi standards so I did not expect to be subject to a hour of regular high pitched screaming and much running around.

I popped into Benihana kings road on a Monday evening to grab some dinner. It was half empty. I shared the lobster meal with my guest and it was just enough for a light dinner. It's one of those places you have to visit to see what it's about but the food was nothing special. It's over priced and I think the focus of the visit is on he chef preparing the food in front of you and not actually the quality of the food. Overpriced and my clothes smelt of food when I left the restaurant.

Booked a birthday of 8 people at Benihana's Kings Road for 8pm. I arrived with others at 7.50pm checked in at the front of house and they don't me we were the first ones there and to wait in the long/bar area which we did. Ordered drinks and waited for the rest of our party to arrive. Everyone arrived but one person arrived by 8.10pm. Waiters come up and took our drinks order and we sat and waited. By 8.45pm we were wondering what was happening with the table so I asked the waitress and they said that they had given away our table as we weren't all here on time. Outraged I asked why no one had told us. Blank faced ignored the question and told me that we were all late and that's the policy. I then asked to speak to the manager who was just as clueless and rude. Not explaining why he had given away our table without informing us. Arriving early and being told to wait in the bar they knew we were waiting for the table yet still they ignored us. The manager said there's nothing he can do as there are no tables and we should wait. By 9.15pm we were still waiting and by then my party was frustrated, hungry and shocked at the service being received. No apology was given and no one seemed to care. We ended up leaving the restaurant and the whole birthday celebration was ruined. We had all travelled from out of London just to be ignored and treated like rubbish.  I would never return to this place again. Clearly it's popular because of the chefs performances when cooking the food but the service is terrible. No people skills. The manager hasn't got a clue what he is doing. Overall embarrassment.
Amazing! Atmosphere, food, service. I can't wait to visit again. Well worth the price tag. Would recommend for all to try....

We visited this location of Los tacos no. 1 while wandering in the evening around times Square. There is a decent choice of food items and some cool drinks as well, so we tried a bunch of them. The food, as in the other locations we have been to, was simply amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Pity though that there was a huge fan blowing air straight onto our necks, and that made eating in an already crowded shop unpleasant. We ate very quickly and left. If you plan a visit, try to go in off-peak hours to enjoy your experience to the fullest.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We have been gifted some voucher for a dining experience and, after checking reviews, we chose V zatisi. The place is located in a quiet alley not far from Charles Bridge, is nicely furnished and has an OK variety of food choices. We chose the Indian degustation, which consisted of an amouse bouche, a soup, a fish, tikka masala and a dessert. The highlight of the meal were the mains, while the other dishes to us seemed only a way to complete a menu. Soup decent but not at its price tag, dessert was good but spices from the pineapple overpowered the Gelato. Overall food was good and we enjoyed it, but I think for its price it is definitely not worth it. Upon arriving, we Said we had made a reservation but at the desk they did not have it, but luckily it was not busy at 12. Service was unfortunately luckluster and not up to the standard of a high-end restaurant; in such other premises in Prague the waiting staff would enunciate meals, here no one said a thing and for each dish I needed to go online and check their website. Frantisek was nice (the lady so so, especially when we showed the voucher) but all in all I think if they want to charge this much some improvements need to be taken. I tipped (as I have never tipped in my country actually) but did not feel like doing it.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Best dinner i have had in years
review_data.review: An outstanding evening in a wonderful restaurant. Before I get to the food it is worth saying that the seating, décor and staff are all really wonderful. Just such a rare treat to sit in an environment like this and be treated with such charm and understated professionalism. We had the oxtail ravioli and award winning game pate to start. Both superb. Followed by cod and scallops again both just dreamy. Chocolate Soufflé and the millefeuille as puddings. My wife was totally silenced by the soufflé and said not a word uttering weird sounds as she finished the dish in 7 minutes flat. Sublime she said. All complemented by a lovely Sancerre. Not a lot more to say other than this is the most deserved one star I have ever been in.
I had a great brunch with great food! My waiter was a nice guy with excellent service. Recommend for London visitors who are close by to Oxford street.
It is a simple Greek taverna serving good Greek food I particularly liked the lamb although it was slightly overcooked. The service attentive and good and all in all I would certainly go back.
I went to this restaurant for lunch. I ordered a mixed fish. They offered me the traditional Portuguese "vinho verde" and was well worth trying. I will definitely return to the restaurant

I'm not surprised we got the last reservation for dinner though we booked it several days in advance and this is not tourist season. Word is out that they have good food.  My partner and I shared a prawn appetizer. Do Europeans think it's fun for customers to dismember whole prawns, eyeballs and all? It's not! I don't like having to work so hard to get to the edible bits in a restaurant. The prawn flesh was tasty and the lemony garlicky sauce was good enough to eat with a spoon (which I did).  We both ordered the grilled octopus that came with a few thin spears of broccolini and three small whole potatoes. The octopus was perfect. Tender and succulent, with delicious shavings of crispy garlic in the sauce.  We asked for tap water and were given filtered water and charged 1.50 euro. Not a lot but tap water is very drinkable in Lisbon and they should make it available for free.  To compliment the meal we each had a glass of tasty wine, not overpriced at 5 euro a glass.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review: We ordered a pizza quarto and got a pizza with the four individual toppings (mushroom, artichoke, ham, olives) concentrated in each quarter of the pizza. That was weird. We had to redistribute the toppings ourselves to get what we wanted.  The pizza was tasty but the dough was very thin and didn't hold up under the toppings. This a pizza that requires a knife and fork.  Why were we brought a basket of foccacia with the pizza instead of before, to munch on while we were waiting?  The caprese salad consisted of a lot of cut up cherry tomatoes and a big hunk of mozzarella cheese resting on a bed of arugula. It needed balsamic vinegar.  We went because it was so highly rated but I was unimpressed.  The servers are very pleasant. Perhaps they were understaffed the night we went because there were definitely not enough people handling the front of the house.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Everything was perfect from beginning to the end! Food was delicious, and the Apple tart is best I have ever eaten! Eat here next time you're in NYC!

Not the cheapest place in town but it has a dignified ambiance and a wonderful palette of food to enjoy. Small tip if you need reading glasses take them - wine list v small writing! I had foie gras followed by boar followed by cheese. I red from Moravia and some excellent service throughout the evening. Also book - gets very busy.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Casa Saltshaker during our September trip to Buenos Aires. This was our first experienced of a closed door dinner and it was very positive. The setting was intimate, with the 10 of us situated around a common table. The group dynamic was fun and it was a great chance to exchange travel advise and compare out notes on Argentine culture. As virtually all the other reviews here attest, the food was excellent. Dan and Henry do an excellent job of presenting creative dishes with well paired wines. We will definitely be trying some of his recipes. Dan is an especially hospitable host and gave great advise about the dining scene in Buenos Aires.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: We were staying nearby last weekend and on reading the reviews thought we would give this cafe a visit. We had breakfast on Saturday morning -both ordering the English breakfast and then returned again on Sunday morning when I swapped to the English Potato hash. Both mornings we received excellent friendly service from our witnessed but Nora also made a point of coming out of the kitchen and chatting to us and making sure everything was ok. T The food was freshly cooked, plentiful and so tasty with a great menu where anyone can get food to eat -there are Turkish and mediterranean choices, healthy, vegan and vegetarians options. On Saturday one table were requesting changes to their breakfast because they eat only halal meat and on Sunday a Jewish gentleman asked for his breakfast to be cooked in a particular way, nothing was too much trouble. Absolutely no faults to be found. I even used the loo upstairs on Sunday and it was immaculately clean. If we lived nearby it would become a local.

We had vegetable tempura followed by the vegetable Khmer curry and vegan Amok and then chocolate sorbet and chocolate cake. All was simply gorgeous. We could eat here every night. So professional, so delicious, stunningly ng and the added bonus of helping such a worthy cause.

Food was soooooo tasty! And they made a show with fire .. Service is amazing since it’s a family restaurant. They gave us free baklava which was the tastiest. Thanks a lot! Definitely recommended...

review_data.review_title: Mains Terrible but Service and Complimentary items Great
review_data.review: Overall I would say this restaurant didn't really live up to expectations, especially since it is very expensive.  We ordered two different chicken dishes, while we waited were served a plethora complimentary items, all very tasty and almost worth visiting for alone. Also the service was very good (something quiet uncommon in Argentina). We were a little put off by the paper table cloth and ikea style glasses, I think at this price they can do better.  Still we were really happy until the mains arrived, these we exceptionally dry, fatty and tasteless. If I had cooked that at home I would be apologising to my family. One dish was virtually inedible because it had been crisped so much on the outside and the inside was tasteless. Very disappointing.
Completely pleased with service and food quality. You cant go wrong if you want to opt for an Indian dinner night. Good job guys. Highly recommended.
