review_data.review_title: Great evening of wine and food
review_data.review: A tiny little restaurant (Italian) tucked away in a small street not far from the river - it only seats about a dozen people - BOOK (well in advance) We tried some divine wines from Puglia and you get to taste before you buy a glass, you get plenty of friendly help and advice on choosing what is right for you and to go with the food you have ordered. The Food - delicious home cooked Italian ‘Tapas’ style dishes - so yummy, we had the Bruschetta, Goats cheese with pine nuts and honey and the aubergine Parmigiana and meatballs - Delicious:0 Home made tiramisu and chocolate pudding accompanied by a dessert wine - mmmmm - an excellent, fun and ‘different’ evening thoroughly enjoyed every moment,mouthful and morcel :) thank you Wine O’clock (Cash Only )

Hope to see you again soon, thank you for having me ♥️

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We like the food here. Service can be erratic. On this visit the front of the restaurant was sectioned off for a private holiday party. Needless to say they were enjoying their cocktails and were very loud. This impacted our leisurely dining experience in a negative way. I believe when restaurants decide to take large parties that will impact the "regular" diner, they should accommodate the other patrons in some way... a drink, dessert, something to acknowledge the inconvenience... not just think it's ok.  Our coconut shrimp, crab cakes, salads, and the taco soup were very good. Chicken and Tuna entrees were enjoyed by all. The cold mashed potatoes served with the chicken were happily replaced.  Wines and drinks were very good.  Not our best meal here but still like the restaurant. Service needs improvement and ask about parties that may be booked... I guess it will calm down after the holidays but still beware.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We had a reservation for New Year’s Day. Unfortunately they were out of lamb, which was our first choice. The steak was very good as was the wine selection. However, there were several things that affected our experience. First, one of the hostesses kept spraying an awful air freshener. It reminded me of being on an airplane in certain countries when they disinfect the plane. Horrible! My husband later learned that they were using it to camouflage a sewage problem they were experiencing in the men’s room. Our waiter started out great, but we never saw him after placing our order as he was then moved to serve a large party. Consequently we never had service again. We had to wait 40 minutes to get our check. A hostess noticed my dissatisfaction when leaving and asked if everything was okay. When I explained about the service, she just said they were busy. I think there are better restaurants to spend your money in than Cabernet.

review_data.review: A restaurant that has only improved in 10 years. Flawless quality that has built its reputation, the rave reviews on TripAdvisor speak volumes and reflect reality. It has become an obligatory gastronomic passage in Phuket.

Always the best for eating in family or for an event like Valentine's. The imported tuna is the best of the island,(really fresh fish),and the chicken in duxelle was really good. Kids love always his spaghetti bolognaise . The menu offers a very large choice of fish,meats,wines and beers. It's my 3 stars restaurant.

This restaurant is clearly my favourite in Cambodia and I also find the prices reasonable, for what they offer. They have an amazing variety and each dish is absolutely amazing. The staff and especially our waiter Sros are very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive... He could even tell is about the flowers decorating our table. I hope my wife agrees to visit this restaurant on all 4 nights of our visit in Siem Reap. Do not miss this place

review_data.review_title: Minimalistic effort in the kitchen and decrease in general
review_data.review: This used to be my favourite restaurant in Cambodia but the service and food have decreased with the fame of this place. I booked a table online 1.5 days in advance and the one nice table, in front, outside which I asked for, when walking in, the waiter told me that there was a bad smell at this table and I should either sit inside or out the back, which is not nearly as nice as the seats out front. At one stage we were told that our main dishes would be out in 3 minutes... They arrived 15 minutes later. I ordered the chicken with spicy basil and asked them to cook the dish extra spicy. What they did is cook the dish as usual and put a spoon full of fresh, chopped chillies on top of the dish, why would a good cook do something so minimalistic? They offer no complementary water... many other restaurants do, you can order a 1.5 liter bottle of local water (not carbonated) for $4.50 which is outrageous for Cambodia.

we always stop in and have dinner or lunch @ Tevy’s Place. Tevy and her staff are so welcoming. Excellent service and menu choices at a very reasonable price. She brings in and trains young women in all aspects of running a restaurant. Thanks for being a successful entrepreneur and for training, coaching and mentoring young adults.

This is another amazing social profit enterprise. They take in disadvantaged youth. They train, educate, coach and mentor young adults to be self-sustaining and employed in today’s world. They also run a 1st class restaurant with excellent food, ambience and incredible customer service. Thank You for what you do.

They take in disadvantaged youth - train them in life skills, work skills, hospitality management - being servers, cooks , chefs , managers etc. Then trainees are sent out to other hotels for internships and then after graduation they all find jobs in the local Siem Reap hospitality industry. A remarkable process. Train your staff well and they will look after your customers.

This restaurant is a dream and a Haven for dis-advantaged youth. Paul and his wife ( owners) started this project in order to provide youth with an opportunity to acquire life, work and employment skills. Youth go through an internship process for a number of months. When they graduate they are hired at local high-end restaurants as they have excellent hospitality skills, knowledge abilities. So, when in Siem Reap you will have to eat , so I ask that you dine at this restaurant support their cause.

I found this restaurant on TA / the reviews are very good and decided to try one of it’s Khmer stir fry dishes the menu is varied and has Khmer, Thai and some western food choices as well. The chicken stir fry was excellent - lots of fresh veggies and lots of really nice breast of chicken. The sauce was great, thanks - will be back again .
Simply amazing menu choices - super fresh, healthy, wholesome, delicious and great customer service. Whoo Hoo I highly recommend this restaurant

I love this restaurant. The food was s 12/10 , interesting ambience, great staff and excellent customer service . If you sit a front you can watch them cook your meal. All female staff. This place is another social profit enterprise. Tevy supports educational programs for disadvantaged youth - specifically females in Siem Reap. She deserves the Order of Cambodia. Pucs to follow

simply an amazing restaurant. Here is another example of a social profit agency that works the restaurant business and puts $$$ back into the community. You just have to go there. The food, music, decor, ambience and customer service is Outstanding.

As I said it was Ok, not Oh Woo Hoo amazing like the other reviewed. Now that being said It was mid afternoon and I stopped for chicken satay as an appies and had a glass of red vine. The server showed me the bottle and I reviewed the label as I held the bottle. What I was served was a cold glass of wine. It either not what he showed me or an opened bottle that was in The fridge. Somewhat disappointing. The satay presentation was good - but the chicken was chewy and lacked a proper seasoning. The service was very good.

The restaurant is a bit off the beaten track, but well worth the visit. We had the set Khmer menu. We had our first taste of fried crickets (appetizer) and the wontons were excellent. All in all a lovely meal in nice surroundings and on top of it for a good cause.

We were here last night. Called in to make a reservation and the team helped us out pretty fast. The table is ready by the time we arrived. Anh Luu were our waitress for the night, she was lovely and very helpful with the ordering and during our meal. She even bought out the special mocktail & a bag of gift for me & my partner.  There’re variety of food’s choices. We got salads for entree and Spaghetti & roasted duck for main course. The duck were a bit over cooked than my preference. However, great experience overall  Huge thanks to Anh Luu & the red bean’s team.

There's always something special about returning to Ginja Taste. Such a nice ambience with a great menu and service. From the moment we arrived and were greeted so warmly, to the end of the night before we left and the Chef came around to see if we liked what we ordered...well the plates were all empty! The soft shell salt and pepper crab and the yellow beef curry were to DIE for! Thank you Chef Tham for your gracious hospitality. We keep coming back here...keep up the fantastic standard.

review_data.review_title: Great food, staff, setting: perfect for a special meal
review_data.review: I very rarely give a 5/5 review but this place knocked my socks off. Birthday dinner last night was exceptional. Chosen because it had the right combination of romantic interior and raves all over for the food. The raves about the food are well deserved: pix cannot convey ... The delicacy and imagination of every dish was outstanding. The amuse bouche cleverly presented, delicious. The starters excellent. The duck beautifully prepared and presented. The turnip a revelation. The suckling pig: perfect crisp exterior, melt-in-your -mouth tender. Even the bread they make with little hints of chorizo & pecorino, made with lardo, served with two kinds of butter, and the potatoes delivered in a little cart... Five desserts? Kind of over-the-top I appreciate. The sommelier was from Sardinia. The waiter from Basilicata. They both were warm, helpful, and truly were a huge part of making our experience so enjoyable. Service from arrival to goodbyes: impeccable. If you come to London, put this on your list. But make a reservation. This was a Tuesday night early February and every table was taken (and the restaurant is deceptively large: winds around unfolding to five small dining areas, plus a bar.) One of the best meals of our trip. Actually, the best. Grazie mille!

And, we appreciated the wine recommendations from George, that nicely complimented our meals. Five of us in our party with a variety of dishes we all enjoyed. Fresh ingredients, seasonings and cooked perfectly. We recommend.

My secret suggestion is to treat yourself first at LE BAR (same hotel as 114 at Le Bristol), then dinner and dessert at 114. It will be memorable.
Serious taste in this 40 seat thai resturant. Cannot go wrong. Fun vibrant atmosphere for a small place too!

This was my favorite place we ate at during our stay in Marrakech. The inside of the riad was so beautiful. The staff was friendly. The food was SO good. I sampled the salmon, beef fillet, lamb, and duck breast. It was all delicious. The duck was amazing. We also had the creme brûlée. We didn’t have traditional Moroccan food, but it is on the menu. Great prices. If you are in the area, you must try this place!

If you love a good piece of lamb, then try here. Absolutely divine. As soon as you walk through the doors, your senses are smothered with a beautiful lamb scented smell. Word of warning, they only do one size, large shoulder roast (with potatoes and gravy). This is enough for two adults or a family. I bought one for myself as I was travelling solo (yay, no wife and kids). It gave me dinner, breakfast and a snack after snowboarding the next day. The flavours were lovely and worked well together. The gravy and potatoes were nice and the lamb was pull apart, melt in your mouth. Do yourself a favour and try this with your friends and family. The site is about a 10 minute stroll from Central Queenstown (Fergburger as a reference) so its easy to get to. A really nice lamb dinner.

I had this last time, all by myself. It lasted me for 3 meals, dinner, breakfast and then dinner again while I was staying at my hotel. I went with the wife and friends this time and had to get them to try it. We ordered a delivery to the hotel for this which cost an extra $8. Well worth it if you don't have a vehicle and don't want to walk to get it. The delivery was spot on time. The lamb was still as tender and melt in you mouth as i'd remembered. Everyone loved it. It served 4 of us nicely. I will definitely be ordering this again next time I am in Queenstown.

review_data.review_title: Not the experience we expected -- is it (becoming) a tourist trap

We checked the outside out before and found the place (not so easy). Arriving in time as required explicitly, many foreigners waiting, seemed a bit a cruiseship tour of overspending retired world travelers, not the hip and young people we like to be with... anyway. There was a power breakdown at the start... and not a real nice process to find a place to sit, instructions chaotic. Anyway we paid 200 USD for an experience but were quite disappointed. A minimal sald, some starters of low quality and undescribed and some cheese to be shared and a so-so quality steak (very low on our list of previous experiences in the USA or Colombia or Brasil or France). Dessert also average. Overall very disappointing to us. Fortunately the rest of our holidays really compensated for this bad start in a former garage without windows. Not recommended, though friendly people (who make an awful lot of US dollars instead of pesos).

This was like watching an opera / Orchestra the way the team at the front worked together lead by one of the best maitre d’s that I’ve seen all the staff gliding around the floor taking orders and bringing out the food and drink lead by a master of her craft As for the food WOW the pasta was like eating silk with the richest Ragu the best comfort food ever Thanks so much to Mr Theo Randall for taking the time out for a chat and signing a couple of his cook books for me it really made my birthday All I can say is I can’t wait to come back TOTALLY AMAZING ‍

review_data.review: Fred R Barnard, advertising executive, is credited with the saying that a picture is worth a thousand words. Well, I’ve been admiring the pictures of Big Boys Burger Club offerings for three years and finally put his claim to the test.  Sorry Fred, the picture simply doesn’t convey the explosion of taste in that first mouthful of juicy double stack burger that is the El Clasico, sheer burger bliss. I elected to have the patties cooked medium well, and the result was a juicy burger with two patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and the tomato aioli sauce. The Big Boy, another winner with the crispy bacon topping the patties. Toasted pineapple slices gave the Waikiki a different taste sensation and the Croc Dundee with the fried egg and beetroot was just an amazing meal. Mustn’t forget the onion rings and the ice cold Changs. My wife enjoyed her Blues Brothers (without the bun) and on other nights the chicken wings , chicken on green plate and those tasty chips.  There are still more gourmet creations to be sampled, another trip from OZ necessary, the YOLO remains a challenge to be tackled.  Great vibe in the restaurant, a warm welcome from staff and the elegant owner, impeccable unobtrusive service throughout. I’d recommend these burgers to anyone, they are just delicious taste combinations.

review_data.review: Visited on the recommendation of our tour director. Escorted from our hotel across the road to the entry path where we were greeted by a waiter from the restaurant. We decided to dine inside and not brave the external hammock style arrangement. Dining area somewhat sterile and lacking atmosphere although there is high quality decor throughout. I would consider the restaurant a fine dining experience with matching prices and will give an "excellent" rating based on the quality of the meals.

I went on my own for dinner, but should of taken a second person, they have beautiful tapas for sharing as well as you could order a main dish. The pork belly was so tender and tasty. As well as my other dishes.
Had a business lunch here. Place is small and intimate, food is good and innovative, service attentive and friendly.Prices fair. Nothing not to like.

The welcome at the restaurant was friendly and professional. We were shown to our table and attended by Asmita who was friendly efficient professional and informative without being over attentive. Food was full of flavour and extremely good .would highly recommend
Great experience. Team took very good care of our table and the food was delicious! Will definitely come back.

review_data.review_title: Totally different and fun experience in Buenos Aires
review_data.review: A friend recommend that we do a "puerta cerrada" (closed door) dinner in Buenos Aires, so I booked this through Viator. We absolutely loved it, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. We had some of the most amazing food I have ever had in my life here, and we dined with other Americans and Europeans too. Luis and the other hosts were really nice, and the loft itself and the view are great. This is such a different experience and a must-do in Argentina. As others have described, it is a five-course meal with wine for every course. Save your appetites for this! I highly recommend this experience.

Never been to one of this chain before so I was intrigued. It was excellent. The starter was a lobster roll which was superb. Then had a t bone steak. It was quite hard to cut but tasted so good with the amazing blue cheese sauce. Finished with a dessert of fudge and ice cream which was a huge and delicious portion. Was impressed and the bill was very reasonable for a steakhouse. Service was reasonable. Small restaurant adjoined to a hotel.
The experience is very classy with good staff and an excellent taster menu. Enormous wine list if that’s your thing. Good time. Pricey but you pay for the whole atmosphere.

review_data.review_title: Not that this restaurant needs another 5* review...
review_data.review: ...but I'll add to it anyway!  My friend surprised me with a visit here for my birthday, me a vegetarian and her very much a carnivore. The food is incredible! So many amazing flavours and the chef has clearly put a lot of thought into how the dishes all go together.  Not only is it delicious, but it is greatvalue for money. £20pp gets you the grande selection - a tapas-style offering of nearly everything on the menu. It's more food than we could eat (and boy did we try!). Favourite dishes included the cashew cheeze, the homemade pakoras and the two curry dishes.  You get free top ups of any dish you want (we couldn't manage that) and they give you doggy bags to take away your left overs. The vegan brownie we had for dessert was TO DIE FOR. Oh how can it be so rich and crispy and gooey all at once, and accompanied by delicious vegan ice cream.  You bring your own booze but we also tried the delicious complimentary tea at the end. They were also kind enough to give us little pots of the tea mix to try at home!  The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with everyone cooing when their selections arrived, and the staff were incredibly lovely and helpful.  This is a gem in Earlsfield and I'll definitely be back, bringing friends (veggies and non-veggies alike) so that we can feast again!!

review_data.review_title: A burger joint with a twist
review_data.review: Bill’s Bar and Burgers A burger joint with a twist The burgers at Bill’s are delicious but the thing that sets them apart is the Fat Cat, a burger that comes on an English muffin. What a genius idea! The bun won’t get soggy. And after walking around Midtown and Times Square for days and seeing $20-$25 burgers listed on all of the menus, it was refreshing to find a $13 burger at Rockefeller Center.
Bleecker Street Pizza is the real deal. Awesome New York style slices. The Nonna Maria pizza is my favorite pizza ever. Special thanks to Greg for the birthday slice and great conversation!

review_data.review_title: Unique brasserie experience! TOP service and quality
review_data.review: It was the second visit to the Bristol Hotel (unfortunately I could not stay there yet) as I tried Epicure two years ago.  Though first '114' experience and I must say that this was the most uncommun 1-star-restaurant we have ever been to!  When walking into the restaurant hostess greeted and guided us to a nice table (by the way: if you want to have a nice and tranquil dinner go for the upper level as they feature an 'open' kitchen on lower level which may be a bit noisy... )  The reason why 114 is awarded 1 star is an A-Level-Service and dishes of exceptional quality!  And we appreciated the fact that you do not feel to dine in a 'hotel-restaurant' because it has a separate entrance from the street.  The menu basically gives the choice of some nice meat and fish courses (salmon was over-the-top!!!) and so far it is the only michelin-starred restaurant serving a burger...  Well we are looking forward to being back soon :)  Greetings to the whole Team

A bit more high-end compared to street eateries around you, but very enjoyable and tasty meal in pretty setting and great drinks served from the rooftop bar. The only minor complaint would be we had to wait for paying a bit longer than we would have liked after we finished eating.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Dammar Lounge Fine DIning - The BEST in Siem Reap for fine dining! Don't miss it!
review_data.review: My husband and I recently had dinner at Damak Lounge on two occasions on our past trip to Siem Reap. It’s elegant and very tasteful. A hidden gem in Siem Reap! Perfect decor and a lovely staff. We’ve had dinner here in the past and it was awesome but some menu items have changed and it’s a “must do” if in Siem Reap. You won’t find this quality of dining anywhere else. Upon arrival you are guided by a host and taken by elevator to the second floor - the Privileged Floor by Lotus Blanc where Damak Lounge is located. My husband is on a special diet and they saw to his every need. Kanika our host made our first reservation while explaining all the amenities in the area. The restaurant has an extensive wine list as well as cocktails. I had champagne and it was heavenly. There’s no rush, couples and families at tables chatting and celebrating in a low tone. Extremely top shelf. Last year when we were there they had live music but this time a nice selection of soft music playing. I’m writing my review and wishing we were there now! One night we were pretty tired so we ordered and our meal was delivered to our room. It was perfect. If you want something that’s not on the menu, just tell them, and it will happen. Mr. Jacky suggested Damak Lounge along with a couple other places. But Damak Lounge was a home run! Don’t miss it!

We feel compelled to leave a review for AKAR Restaurant in Ubud here. It’s quite new and I’m unsure if it’s overly mainstream, yet! It is hand-on-heart the best food I’ve ever tasted in my life. Packed with flavour.  We only found it by googling “best dinner in UBUD”  We tried so, so many places in Ubud, including Twist, Elys Kitchen, and many more — all amazing, by the way. However, we went to AKAR & our minds were blown. A notch above everywhere we’ve been at home and in Bali.  The atmosphere is unbeatable. The service is surreal, even for bali standards (already a high standard). The food - phenomenal.  The dark chocolate soufflé is out of this world, as is the warm brownies.  Ps: no, this is not “cheap & cheerful”, but it’s also not too far at the “fine dining” end of the spectrum either…. portions are good sized. It is truly a must.  Cocktails also unreal.  If you come to UBUD and don’t try this place, you’ve missed out (and Twist)  Finally - no, I’m not on commission ha ha. I am just on my honeymoon and had some of the best food ever & best service ever.  Special shout out to Kwai and Rian, our two servers they went completely above and beyond  Cheers!!

Just off the main street, this cozy restaurant offers diverse and tasty tapas in a friendly atmosphere. We loved the Asian-inspired duck breast with sweet potato puree, truffle mac and cheese, shrimp tempura, and a great cheese plate. The owners/brothers were very welcoming (in French and English) and explained all items on the menu.

review_data.review_title: Tastiest food we had in Turkey
review_data.review: Great food, nice experience, the place is worth of the 1st place in rating) Try stuffed calmar and baked meat with fruits

user_data.user_tags: History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We had Sunday dinner at Le Grand Cru and it was simply fantastic. My pasta with truffle was specially memorable. The room was lovely and quiet and the staff was so nice.

Checked out some review on Tripadvisor before heading out for some evening drinks and food. We decided to have a stroll around some of Lisbons many bars and eateries and graze on some of the fantastic food. ( well that was the plan ) We both liked the look of Grau Douro from the reviews and found the establishment very easily in Rua Dunques de Braganca. On arrival the small (but cosy) place was very busy and having no booking we were offered a seat at the bar.This offer was accepted and the owner came straight over with the drinks menu , we are not knowledgeable about Portuguese wine so asked for some guidance. He asked what we liked and suggested a couple of wines ( neither were expensive) and promptly poured a taste of each, followed by a full measure. We quaffed the lovely wine ordered some more and asked for the food menu. The owner who was clearly in control of the whole show was exhilarating to watch , moving from table to table , laughing and joking with the customers and even playing the accordion from time to time a delight to observe. The food arrived Covert ( bread with oil ) the Prawns in garlic sauce and a portion of Bacalhau a bras (codfish , slices of potato and egg cooked in the oven) both dishes were absolutely delicious. Unfortunately by siting at the bar the Toucinho do Ceo do Avo ( Grandpa`s Heavenly Tart ) was positioned on the bar top just in front of us , so a portion along with a very nice glass of port had to be consumed to finish the night. Everything about the place is fantastic, the food is amazing , the staff are friendly and great , the atmosphere is homely , all in all a great find , needless to say we only managed the one bar that night best laid plans and all that. Grau Douro thankyou for a Fantastic Evening. We will be back.

review_data.review: This was our first time at Zen Eat and we were certainly not disappointed we had been recommended the restaurant and it was a great experience. The staff were brilliant, attentive, friendly and efficient. The food was amazing, thoughtful, well executed and presentation and taste were amazing. It was very reasonably priced and we had a great evening. We look froward to returning soon with friends! thanks

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Last year we visited the area and ended up at another well known burger shack. Later that day we stumbled upon Bill's. It looked so appealing and smelled heavenly from the sidewalk. I made a mental note & planned on visiting on our next trip to NYC for the holidays. Fast forward 1 year and here we are at Bill's Bar & Burger!  Upon arrival, we walked inside and found the place pretty packed. We were asked IF we had made reservations and the answer was "no". So, we were expecting the worst. However, we were told to head on down the steps and meet the hostess at the bottom of the stairs to be seated. At the bottom, no one was waiting for us. So we approached the hostess stand and got in line there. We explained that we had been sent down from upstairs. After a few minutes we were seated at a HIGH top and given menus. I was a little concerned about the HIGH seats since we had 2 small children in our party, but there were no other seats available at the time. A waiter was around and said he would be with us shortly. We waited and waited and waited. Finally, we see the waiter ask someone else to wait on us. It seemed like chaos.  We ordered 2 burgers and a basket of the sweet potato waffle fries. We also ordered a kids hotdog, which is a foot long! It came with a side of regular french fries and a kids beverage for $10. A regular burger runs around $13 and does NOT come with any sides. Add bacon for an upcharge.  It took about 35 minutes from the time we walked through the door to the time our food was arriving at the table. Everything looked amazing. Burgers were plump, juicy and oh so flavorful. Delish! Bacon was amazing. Regular fries were very tasty, crispy on the outside yet fluffy on the inside. Sweet potato waffle fries were disappointing. They had great flavor but were thin and turned out oh so crunchy and crispy. We asked for a new basket that was not overcooked. Well, we ended up with a second batch of crunchy fries.  Overall, we had a really good meal at Bills Burger & Bar. The burgers were really good. The kids enjoyed the hot dog & so did we since we had to help eat the foot long dogs. Regular fries were good, although they are probably frozen and not fresh cut. Sweet potato waffle fries were a miss. Prices were a tad high, but we expect that in NYC near Rockefeller Center. Dining room area was OK. It felt cramped and I was NOT crazy about the high top tables (for kids or adults). Downstairs seating felt like a basement, where as the upstairs was little more airy with a bar-pub overtone. Restrooms were clean, but one of the toilets kept leaking water on the floor. Staff was friendly. Service is a tad on the SLOW side. So, do not go if in a hurry. I would recommend. I will be back, but next time I will make reservations in hopes of getting a booth or regular table instead.  Bottom Line: Excellent burgers. Well worth a visit if in the area. Would recommend and will most likely be back next Christmas!
Great restaurant with lots of character. Loved the way the cocktails were presented, plus they were delicious. Food was piping hot and fresh. Excellent all round!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Delicious food and great service. Really appreciated the recommendations. Recommend the bun cha Hà Nội which was delicious!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: This is -I believe- the Nbr 3 Restaurant within a total of about 5000 in Buenos Aires. Drink, 1st and 2nd course, wine, dessert, coffee and a plus: $ 26.00 per person and excellent service as well. UN BE LIE VA BLE !

Very impressed - the relatively small restaurant had a great feel to it. Food was 5 star and impressive. Service attentive all night. My only improvement was that the waiters were not terribly well dressed for the quality of restaurant I expected with un-ironed shirts and a little untucked.

A wonderful dining experience from start to finish. From the moment we were welcomed at the door to leaving we were completely taken care of. Foor was wonderful and so traditional French. Restaurant is a beautiful setting. Service exceptional.

It's a while since we have visited LP. The bar area has been updated a little. We had excellent cocktails served with veg crisps. The 3 course set lunch was great, and there were some nice canapés to start with and v pleasant brioche bun. Service is god, wine list good with some reasonably priced wines. My smoked halibut tart with egg yolk was particularly memorable. My only criticism was the online booking system, which ch offered set 3 course lunch £29, Evening standard offer 3course with glass of fizz £35, or a la carte. We booked the former, but were given the middle. Small detail, but needs tidying up. Otherwise superb lunch and great value.

review_data.review_title: Excellent food but a bit deserted
review_data.review: The food here is always of the highest standard. A little disappointed that we were not offered the set lunch menu. Apparently you have to write that in text on the electronic booking form. Nonetheless food good, wine a bit pricey but good. Dining room is nice if a little dark, and very few diners for lunch. I had an excellent seafood taglierini followed by a mushroom risotto. Both were superb. Still strongly recommend, but check carefully the various booking arrangements.

Food was excellent. Loved the dessert. Very professional and friendly staff. I would highly recommend this restaurant, We had a lunch there today with family and enjoyed it very much, meal is awesome, especially the Dorado fish, chicken curry with baked potatoes. Additionally they gave us a salad and the sweetest baklava with Turkish tea as a gift!! I have never tried this kind of Turkish tea, indeed it was prepared very professionally! Teşekkürler!

Found this restaurant via Tripadvisor and it didn’t disappoint. We went at 6.30pm as didn’t have a reservation and we were lucky we did as many tables were reserved only two weren’t. It was made clear that there were two services and we had to leave the table by 8.50pm but that was plenty time for us.  There was a welcome drink/shot presented to us which was a nice touch and the staff were very friendly and knowledgable. The menu was explained and there are a range of tapas style dishes available to choose from with the suggestion that 4-5 dishes are sufficient for 2 people. We ordered five and we did finish them but easily could have stopped at four.  The food was delicious , in particular the truffle mac and cheese and guacamole. We loved everything to be honest. There is complimentary bread and water on the tables which were appreciated. Each tapas dish is averaging €9.  The decor is relaxed and stylish.  There is a happy hour on drinks between 6.30-7.30pm on beer, wine and soft drinks.

review_data.review_title: Utterly romantic Italian restaurant in the heart of the medina
review_data.review: This is a stunning and very romantic restaurant housed within a jewel-like riad which is tucked away down a narrow alleyway in the heart of the medina. Tables are situated around a pool and a central marble courtyard with a mosaic clad fountain. A large speaker provides some cool background beats. The restaurant offers two menus – Moroccan and Italian – with the ability to mix and match both. The latter offered a welcome break from the traditional tagines. The king prawns with diced tomatoes and cocktail sauce and the eggplant mozzarella for starters were both beautifully seasoned and bursting with flavour and the home made fettucine and tortellini parmesan cream for main brought back fond memories of some of the best Italian pasta houses. There is an extensive wine list although the Moroccan wine is slightly on the expensive side. The only downside was the service which can best be described as unfriendly and unengaging and we felt a little rushed with courses arriving quickly when we had indicated we would like a break or, in the case of the bill, unprompted. It was slightly odd to be taken to a back room to pay the bill by credit card but I had nothing to fear in that all of the staff were extremely courteous and polite. This was our stand out favourite restaurant during our nine night stay in Marrakesh and we cannot wait to return.  Tip: Ignore the young men waiting to greet you when you leave the restaurant who will seek to persuade you to follow them on a different route back to the main square on the basis that the conventional route is closed at night. This is a standard ruse at this (and many other) locations and an attempt to fleece you of your hard earned dirhams……

Located on an unassuming picture postcard South Kensington Street, Launceston Place is understated Michelin level cuisine at an affordable price. We had the three course fixed price lunch which came with a glass of fizz but with the option of choosing dishes from the a la Carte menu. The food was a real delight - creative food imaginatively presented and cooked to perfection; coupled with excellent suggestions from the sommelier. Everything was perfect and the service faultless - wonderfully attentive, engaging but not intrusive. This was an amazing dining experience and one we will undoubtedly be repeating - soon.

review_data.review_title: Education changing lives sweetens every dish served.
review_data.review: I cannot believe that this tiny training facility reataurant is not booked out for every weekday for breakast and lunch. Every meal is cooked and served by the sudents learning hospitality skills for free under the guidance of a dedicated team lead by a French NGO. If you go for brekky at 8 am you will be fortunate to see these proud young Cambodians from the poorest of circumstances go through their morning briefing and lessons and enjoy a chance to meet the staff. Inspirational dining! By eating here or staying upstairs in their weekday training hotel you support these youths to move to a bigger and better facility next year and to positively change their lives. AN ABSOLUTE MUST VISIT!!! And I havent even begun to describe the excellent food at incredibly cheap prices!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: I've been curious for a long time how good the brunch at Mlýnec is? It's served on Saturdays and Sundays between 11:30-15:00. The menu changes from week to week. The price is Czk. 1.290, - per person. It includes prosecco, red wine, white wine, beer, coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice and other soft drinks ad libitum. My boss, who is pretty awesome - and has asked me out several times this week - is in Prague with her husband, and I thought it appropriate to ask them out, just once. We usually attend the Grand Restaurant Festival together, but that’s not an option this year. Instead we’ve designed our own culinary week. The menu we had yesterday is below. Food is served at the table. We were given dishes to share, and we were pleased with the portion sizes, which allowed us to taste everything. By the time we had done that, we were also absolutely stuffed. Everything we were served was impressively delicious. The praise came in a stream from all three of us. We were impressed with the quality of the prosecco and wines included in what was effectively an all-you-can-drink package. The service was also absolutely perfect. The team of waiters were quite young and they were well trained in the profession, they were polite, friendly, helpful and had both humour and the courage to bring their personalities to work. When we arrived at 11:30, we discussed whether we could have arrived a little later and still had plenty of time before 15:00. But the service was kind enough to give us plenty of time between courses, we had a good time - and by 14:35 we were ready for dessert, which by the way was a feast of flavours and textures and one of the many highlights of the brunch. We'll be back!  STARTERS Codfish ceviche, shallot, dill Veal tataki, wasabi mayonnaise Beetroot carpaccio, goat cheese, black rice  MAIN DISHES Salmon trout, tabouleh salad, miso, tapioca Pork tenderloin, Guinea-fowl breast, parmesan cheese, herbs, albufera sauce Baked pumpkin, cauliflower, parsley, Brussel sprouts, almond, sweet potato croquete, gruyére cheese, aioli mayonnaise  DESSERTS Pistachio cheesecake, raspberries, chocolate Coconut, almonds, turmeric, vanilla  WINES Prosecco Riondo, extra dry, Veneto White wine: Pinot Grigio , Casalforte, Veneto Red wine: Valpolicella , Casalforte, Veneto

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: Over the years I’ve come to expect Mlýnec to deliver a very good festival menu, which is why this restaurant was the fourth and last round with my Danish friends before they headed back home. It is safe to say that the restaurant didn’t disappoint. We were all blown away by the experience. We were greeted by the manager (I believe) and sat down at a nice table. The interior of the restaurant has been redone, and we liked it. Particularly we liked the acoustics of the room. Noise doesn’t travel from table to table, and we could have a relaxed conversation without raising our voices or listening in on whatever was being discussed by the table next to ours. We had a bowl of bread with 3 different kinds of fresh and slightly warm bread. It was accompanied by a herb spread which had nice, subtle flavours and a perfect temperature. I wanted more bread! But thank God they didn’t give me any (I didn't ask for it), because we were all completely full, when we left the restaurant a couple of hours later. The amuse bouche was delicate foam of smoked potatoes. There were some crunchy bits on top and a bit of sour notes from tiny pieces of pickled vegetables as well. These 2 elements gave some texture, and it was a brilliant little dish. The starter was smoked char with almond milk “caviar”, beluga lentils, horseradish, and marjoram. The trout had a firm, yet tender texture and had received just the right amount of smoke. The subtle horseradish sauce with marjoram complimented both fish and lentils very well and made everything come together. The lentils were perfectly cooked – I am not sure if “al dente” is a way to describe lentils, but I’ll risk it. The almond milk caviar was mainly on the plate for texture, I believe – it didn’t pack a lot of flavour. I like that the “eggs” had different sizes. That worked well visually and also when it came to the texture. The size of the portion was generous – we all agreed that it wouldn’t have been strange at all, if they had served one piece of trout instead of the two nice portions on our plates. The main dish was veal rib eye, beans, dried beef, beets, cashews, and demi glace. We were given a choice how we would like our meat prepared, and we all chose medium. Mine was closer to medium rare, and that was perfectly fine with me. The first impression of the dish came from tasting the demi glace, which was one of the best I’ve ever had. Only the master of sauces, Steven Trumpfheller, has served me a better one. So rich and full of flavour and reduced to the point where it would make my lips stick together. The steak was tender and well seasoned, and it hade more and deeper flavour than I would have expected from veal – more like a young bull. There were 3 different types of beans on the side, all cooked to perfection. The beets added an earthy and sweet/sour dimension, and the small bites of smoked and dried beef held it together, although my first bite was very tough (the rest weren’t). Just as it was the case with the starter, everything on the plate created a perfect combination, and the dish was quite filling. I regretted not having saved a slice of bread to wipe my plate clean with. Not to embarrass my two friends at the table I decided not to lick the sauce off my plate, but the thought crossed my mind. The dessert was macaroon in two ways, cherry, chocolate, tangerine, and basil garnished with raspberries and a blackberry. The macaroon on the side was good, but to me the star of the dish was the clever composition in the middle. I tried tasting the different elements individually, and they went almost all the way around the palate, except for saltiness. Sweet, sour, tart, bitter. And then when they all met in combination with the chewy and a little bit gooey macaroon bottom, it was simply a heavenly mouthful. The menu mentions a pre-dessert as a palate cleanser. Previously it has been a ball of sorbet. They forgot to serve it at our table, but they found out and insisted that we had coffee on the house, accompanied with cute cubes of chocolaty caramel. It was a nice finish to our meal. The service was friendly and attentive, and we were given plenty of time between dishes, which we really appreciate. We were served by different waiters, but the manager always kept an eye on our table and checked every once in a while if we were happy – and it was a pleasure chatting with him. Hospitality must lie in his genes. We agreed that this final festival experience was a perfect ending to this year’s adventure as a group – and most definitely we’re looking forward to repeating it next year! There are 2 seats left for the Restaurant festival at Mlýnec this year: 1 seat on the 12/2 at 17:30 and 1 on the 16/2 at 17:30. Grab them!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review_title: extravagant and glamorous family brunch a world away from your everyday
review_data.review: it’s one of those weekends, the sweetness of the winter sun shines bright and the wind blows cold, it’s summer in the light and winter in the shade - and living the good life in my Dubai and being spoilt for choice with most chic and superlative luxurious hotel and resorts that boast Michelin-starred Restaurants, there can be nothing, simply nothing, most lusted after, than to splurge on an extravagant and glamorous family brunch a world away from your everyday, where you can en famille be immersed in a spellbinding day-cation of sheer luxury and pleasure without limitations, spending uninterrupted hours focusing on us and enjoying face time..  this weekend was all about luxuriating at The Edge - an outdoor Italian Restaurant located on the Royal Pool-side deck at Atlantis The Palm - one of the most majestic 5★ beach resort and an aquatic wonderland on Dubai’s man-made Palm Jumeirah Island - featuring a tantalizing fare of an adventurous culinary and unforgettable brunch experience on a level you never imagined, serving to you a gastronomic fiesta of gourmet delicacies, from the likes of...  piping hot, irresistible and deeply satisfying artisan stone baked italian margherita pizza with an indescribably delicious and voluptuous layer of tomato-basil sauce blended in the mellow richness of fresh mozzarella cheese pleasing to the palette like a short afternoon drizzle..  and if that din’t quite satisfy your hunger pangs, take on the house speciality, Pan-seared Scottish Salmon steak and asparagus smothered in lemon beurre blanc, slapped on one big pot of linguini pasta harmoniously slick with basil pesto - not at all dry and gluey, mixed with a dollop of roasted shallots and plum tomatoes, that had my belly penning thank you notes to my taste buds..  whilst my better half @lillloyds desired for the Winter Tuna Niçoise salad laden with white anchovies and an exotic bite-size quail eggs tossed in green beans, baby potato, kalamata olives and mesclun leaves - truly irresistible to the delight of our 6 year old boy prowling restlessly to not fork-yeah a lions share of the dozen or half quail eggs..  and the Ah! moment in our culinary adventure of flavour and fantasy that had my heart-fluttering and tummy rumbling to a hypnotic trance of sweetness galore, as if cupid shot an arrow right though my heart and into my stomach, was the pièce de résistance, Blood Orange Coulis Panna Cotta laden in a bounty of wild berries.. truth be told, the taste is incomparable and the experience a must-have....

review_data.review_title: Great food, but some confusion in serice
review_data.review: Once we found the right dishes, we really enjoyed the food here. Most of the time service was good, but every now and then there were minor issues (lost reservation, lack of water etc.). A beautiful location for eating outside.

review_data.review_title: Steak ! Steak! Did I mention steak?
review_data.review: Thoroughly enjoyed this adorable restaurant. Family of four.  We ordered two steaks and two salads - typically we have a gigantic appetite for steak and it was a huge amount of food - we suggest you SHARE STEAK AND ONE SALAD MAX PER FOUR PEOPLE.  If you are used to American Caesar salad we suggest passing on this, as their version wasn't what we are used to. Take a look at the other salads as they pass by - very large and deconstructed style. They offer half portions.  The decor of this restaurant was great with drawn on plates by past customers covering the walls and small air planes and toy blimps along the ceilings. It was filled with tourists but we didn't find it "too touristy".  The wait staff were very lovely and kind, spoke English very well.  Our only criticism would be that the food seemed to be rushed - the salad, steaks, and sides all came rushing to the table all at once very quickly overwhelming the table.  Would suggest this to our friends in the future !

review_data.review_title: Family or 'group' type of dining experience
review_data.review: First off warning about inability to find taxis on New Years Eve....UBER transportation suggested by hotel as taxi wait over 90minutes. UBER prices 6-7times higher rates than usual  Arrived on time at 930pm and greeted at bottom of staircase by server who spoke no English but gracious.  Upstairs we ascended to first floor and met other families and guests. Served bubbly wine and hung around WAITING for dinner for an hour. Tasty single appetizer offered for the hour.  1030pm Ascended another flight of stairs to warm/hot small room with basic tables and recorded music.  Served set menu (I believe they do offer vegetarian options) from Nicos' favourite winery I suspect. Not mine unfortunately.  Food was good as were wines - however AS FOODIE and lover of great wines would not have chosen this again as place to spend New Year's Eve. We were asked to use the same wine glasses from one tasting to the next - tacky. Home style cooking and presentation. Some dishes above average in taste - presentation average.  Desserts arrived as the clock struck 12 and we left shortly after.  While I would recommend this as REASONABLY priced wine/dine experience - and the food was good - I DON'T feel this listing deserves to rated number one dining location on TripAdvisor for BA.

review_data.review_title: Outstanding customer service and excellent food
review_data.review: The warm welcome, cool beers and excellent food kept us coming back to Takieng every night of our two-week stay at the Renaissance Resort & Spa. All of the staff - Sam, Amp, Will, Puen, Ness and Paul - went out of their way make our experience enjoyable and learn our preferences in terms of level of spiciness. We liked to sit outside with the ocean view so they provided an ice bucket to keep our Singha beers cold. The extensive menu meant we never ate the same main course twice, though we always chose the same shared mixed starters. The Valentine's Day Meal was a particular triumph with an amazing variety of meat, vegetables and seafood, including lobster.  I was also lucky enough to be able to eat here for breakfast on a couple of mornings when they opened up as the hotel was very full. The Chef's Signature Eggs on smashed avocado, tomato salsa and sour dough served to the table with a fresh fruit smoothie and sparkling wine made a heavenly start to the day. I was quite upset when this stopped and I had to return to the busy hotel buffet.  Be sure to make a reservation for dinner as we saw several people turned away as they didn't have space. Thank you Takieng for a five-star dining experience every night of our stay. x

Takieng is our favourite restaurant when we visit the Renaissance Phuket hotel. We love eating out under the stars every night with the sound of the waves crashing on the shore. Service is excellent from start to finish with a shout out to Mama, Fern, Boom, Ammi and all the lovely team who ensured our beer bucket was kept topped up, our favourite table or nearest one was available, and a supply of crispy crackers and dipping sauce started each meal. We enjoyed sampling some of the signature dishes of locally sourced food -Andaman prawns with sea grapes became my favourite starter. Main course portions were very generous. The chef’s willingness to substitute duck for beef in a Mussiman curry and to tone down the heat on some of the spicier dishes was much appreciated. The Valentine’s Meal this year was especially tasty

I am certainly Italian in my love of food! Dinner begins with focaccia, cherry tomato bruschetta brought unbidden to the table @Theo.Randall @icparklane. The cocktails are rife with strong Italian alcohols like Campari and vermouth, typical cocktails are Negronis and Old Fashioned. We tried both and they are well-fitting with the restaurant. It is impossible to choose one from Primi pasta dishes without regret that you have therefore missed another. When it’s pasta time, go for Taglierini con Gamberetti e Carciofi – a rich, overwhelmingly savoury mix of the freshest pasta with brown shrimps and artichokes. I usually don’t do this but we left our wine choices to the clued-up sommelier who really knew his stuff. In a tastefully decorated open-plan dining room that has plenty of space between the tables, he and his team offer a wide-ranging Italian menu with something for even the trickiest of eaters. Superb evening... flawless service and impeccable attention to detail. Yet another memorable night!

Chamisse is a Lebanese restaurant offering a large selection of classic dishes. The lists of hot and cold mezza (starters) are particularly extensive. Main courses are dominated by the grilled meats for which Lebanese cuisine is so famous, but there are also some stews and soups. Can’t wait to visit again.

We stumbled across this restaurant as it was close to our hotel. What a find! Great Italian food and ambiance. Can highly recommend the gnocchi. Hope to return before we leave Lisbon. Valentim gave us great service and recommendations.
